Summary: We had a great stay here while visiting Disneyland. I think it's about as close of a walk to the parks as you can get without staying at a Disney hotel. The rooms were big, nice and clean and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel staff was really friendly and helpful. There are two pools, two hot tubs and one small kiddie pool. Bushes/topiaries that are sculpted into various animals surround the pool area. The whole resort area was clean and lovely. We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: If you are trying to decide where to stay, go with Stovall's!  We booked with Pavillion's on 07/08/21. Adjusted our reservation on 07/10. Then...for some unknown reason, the General Manager at Pavillion's cancelled our reservation without any notification to us whatsoever on 07/18/21. We arrive in Anaheim on 10/08/21 to find that we have no reservation and that the property is fully booked. All Christian would say is "sorry ma'am, you don't have a reservation and we have no room to put you in." No trying to assist or find us a new location, NOTHING, and, they still had our $800! Our booking agent with HotelEngine was fantastic! She started searching for alternate locations and asked Pavillion's to contact their sister hotel, Stovall's Inn. Boom! Stovall's was able to take us in,
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: We were locked out of our room both nights that we stayed. One night I requested a new key three separate times, each time the key did not work. I had to loudly wake up the people I was staying with so I could get in because the emergency key didn't even work. The next night we were exhausted after a day at the parks and our keys didn't work. We got a new key and got in but it was still frustrating. Also, my car was boxed in so I couldn't leave when I needed to because we had to wait for the person behind me to leave and it offset our day. Our toilet also broke. When we spoke to management to get a refund or something all they did was validate the 45$ paring. It's close to the parks and inexpensive but not worth it.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and letting us know of your concerns. We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and your feedback will help us to better assist the rest of our guests. Thank you again and we hope that you give us another chance in the future.

Summary: This hotel is conveniently located near Disneyland.   It is an easy walk and felt safe.  Staff was friendly,  room clean, and breakfast included.  We dis have to pay to park, but it was less than I have paid at other hotels in the area.  I is a good value for the price. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: Great location, clean, and friendly staff. Hot breakfast in the morning is a great way to start a long day at Disney which is just a short walk away. We stay here all the time when coming to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: This is a great hotel to stay if your visiting the near by parks. Which are in walking distance. There are great food options near, also in walking distance. Hotel is clean, and quite. This particular hotel does offer continental breakfast. We enjoyed it. There is parking available at the property which is $15 a day. We drove into town and used it just to park since we were so close to walk into the parks. Would stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: Ther was no internet in our room, called the front office they basically said because our room was too far from office? they tried to move us to a closer room but the room they took us to was occupied which was weird and scary, we decided to stay at our current room, the bathroom doors were filthy we were able to see all the accumulated filth around and down where the door knobs is.  The top drawer didn't close it kept sliding open and I hit myself with it. The toilet paper holder was broken and the paper didn't stay kept falling. There was no bags for dirty clothes, The breakfast was ok.  At checkout I had to go to the office and get my receipt since I didn't get one, we let the manager know what was going on all he said is sorry, didn't offer us any discount or anything but
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and letting us know of your concerns. We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and your feedback will help us to better assist the rest of our guests. Thank you again and we hope that you give us another chance in the future.

Summary: First time staying at Stovalls. Loved it. From our check In to check out everything was very pleasant and professional. Swimming pools and hot tubs were wonderful. Never over crowded.  Walking distance about 15 min to Downtown Disney.  Loved that feature too.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: rooms were clean  close to Disney  staff was incredible  breakfast was good ( could use seasoning)  fairly quiet  some street noise   bed were hard which for us personally caused hip and back pain  but overall great hotel
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: This was our fourth stay at this property.  We‚Äôve stayed on every floor level.  There is minimum noise from other units.  totally minimal, if any.  The rooms are clean,  the beds are very comfortable as are their pillows.  They use double sheeting protecting the bed comforter.  There is plenty of room for 4 people.  The internet works great.  The pools and hot tub are lovely.  The complimentary breakfast  has something for everyone. A nice way to start the day.  And now. Summary Heading: It's not what it looks like!  Be wary!
Summary: This is a 1970's motel.  The pictures on the internet are completely misleading.  My family and I booked three nights here but after one night we moved down the street paying $20 more for a suite that was 100X better.  I would never stay at this property again.  Old 70's decor and carpet.  Smelled old.  Spiderwebs and mold in the bathroom window.  Portable AC unit.  You could see under the front door welcoming in insects and rodents.  This is not what you'd expect with a Best Western Plus.  Employees were nice and helpful.  It's not their fault the place is a dump!
Manager Response: Thank you for completing the survey regarding your recent stay at our property. Thank you for staying with us and for letting us know of your concerns. Summary: We stayed for 4 nights. Overall the stay was good except for the experience with collecting my parcels which were shipped to the hotel. As the room was booked under my husband's name. I had the parcels to the hotel under his name. My husband was busy at the Trade Show. They refused to release the parcels to me even though I presented my husband's photo ID for verifications. Moreover, I found that they were not diligent on recording the parcels that they received on the guests' behalf. There were no parcel numbers recorded in their book, only recipient's name and date of receipt.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. Summary Heading: Most convient place to stay for Disneyland and Coco's right next door
Summary: The staff was ready for us upon arrival.  Gave us two rooms next to each other on top floor.  Hotel has an elevator and stairs. ARP bus stops in front of the hotel going to resort and coming back, not walking to hotel.  Coco's is next door, excellent food all day.  Up the street, if you drive restaurants or across from resort.  Hotel has laundry for guests to wash clothes and pool is excellent.

Summary: Good value for the money and for the location which is within walking distance to Disney.   You might want to grab the shuttle for a small fee (tickets purchased at hotel gift shop) which is right out the front doors of the lobby.   We chose this option as even the approx. 15 walk after all day at Disney becomes tiring.   The rooms are small but clean and as pictured.   My only complaint is the breakfast.   The food is generic with french toast and waffles kept in a steamer and soggy.  Oatmeal comes from a machine and was terrible.  Lack of seating when hotel is full and everyone leaving early for Disney.   3 outside tables are available but when the temp is only 40 not really doable. Summary Heading: Extermely convienient location with great atmosphere and amenities
Summary: This hotel went above and beyond my expectations.  For the price we paid I was amazed at the centralized location as well as the wonderful breakfast that was provided each morning.  The pool area is beautiful and surrrounded by manicured landscaping, you can see the Disney fireworks at night from there too!  We had double queen rooms which were more than enough space, the beds are very comfortable and the hospitality staff are so attentive to detail when they are tidying your room.  The breakfast is HUGE and there are so many options that I didn't eat the same thing the entire time I was there.  This is a great property and a wonderful option for Disney as you are right across the street!   I would stay here again and again.

Summary Heading: Possibly my favorite hotel stay ever
Summary: I travel for business a lot.  I am focused on getting my work done, so what I want from my hotel is a safe location, reasonably quiet, clean room, decent free wifi, plenty of hot water for my shower, working air conditioning, and - most importantly -  in-room coffee. I don't care about room size, fancy decoration, TV channels, free breakfast, the view, etc.  This place had everything I want, and at a very affordable price, convenient to the Convention Center - it was great!  Plus staff was friendly and helpful without wasting my time in chitchat.  Really the perfect business travel experience.

Summary Heading: Disney Anniversary Trip - Hotel Stay Could Have Been Better
Summary: We stayed for our 7 year anniversary. The hotel exterior and interior was just like the pictures. The staff was friendly. I don't really understand the online check-in as it doesn't save any time. I had wrote a comment asking if there was anything special they could do since it was our anniversary but no one got back to me. No big deal as I knew this wasn't the most classiest hotel, especially after reading some of the reviews (I was a little nervous), but we didn't want to go crazy as we didn't have our son with us this time. It was a little different of a process to check-in and out. Pretty old fashioned. The walls are incredibly thin. We could hear everyone and everything. The water smelt really bad on the vanity sink, like sewer. We used shower water to brush our teeth. They
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Also the room we got was quite noisy, as it was near the street. I always travel with a small fan to help drown out the outside noise and it helped greatly again this trip.  The walk to Disney security line beside Disneyland hotel did not seem too long for us and was pretty at nighttime. (Pic added) Good trip overall even with a few challenges and I will likely recommend this hotel to others as a more reasonably priced alternative to some of the South Harbour hotels.

Sometimes housekeeping had to help us give it the proper ‚Äòjiggle‚Äô The buffet breakfast was not very appealing or appetizing  The air conditioner was very noisy There was an unpleasant cleaning product smell, particularly in the lobby.  The price was ok for a visit to Disneyland, but I would look elsewhere next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for letting us know of your concern with the keys not working. We are currently looking in to upgrading our lock system completely at the hotel. We know that this an issue and we would like to resolve it as soon as possible. Thank you again for your feedback as it will allow us to better serve our guests in the future.

Summary: This a good base for exploring Disney, it is walkable but when the weather is hot you can take advantage of the hotel shuttle service ($5) which you can use as many times as you like - we took advantage of this in the August heat for a lunchtime nap !  The rooms are a little dark and dated, and had a slight smell which improved a little once we had aired the room.  But it was clean and comfortable, although the AC unit in the corner was very noisy throughout the night.    The breakfast service was chaotic, very busy with lots of families with children, could have done with being twice the size and more staff clearing away tables. Reasonable choice of food and drinks though.  Special thanks to Seema on reception who looked after us, we were allowed to check in much earlier than
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and letting us know of your concerns. We are currently implementing new breakfast ideas that will hopefully improve the overall experience of the breakfast room. We appreciate your feedback very much and look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.

Summary: We stayed at this particular hotel because we stayed there in the past and remembered it was a good experience. However, this trip was definitely different. As soon as we arrived we had problems. Our keys to the room wouldn't work so had to wait outside after 10 PM at night to have someone help let us in, dirty beds (found a spider on top of one of the bed sheets), AC units are in the corner of a wall next to a cabinet so it doesn't cool the room well, bathroom very small, parking limited. Breakfast was the best part of our stay but very crowded, no places to sit. Probably won't stay here again.
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future. I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.

Summary Heading: Very Good Location and Buffet Breakfast
Summary: Large room in the very convenient location, walking distance to  Downtown Disney. The breakfast buffet had decent range of food, plenty for everyone. Value for money. The only downside is the dated building itself.  My room smelled of stained cigarette perhaps from oldern days.  All the furnitures were fairly modern.  Coffee maker in the room was a joke, it was not drinkable!  But never mind as I got to drink better coffee at the breakfast, unlimited.  You can take away breakfast as muhc as  you want.  Very generous.  Staff was helpful at the reception.  Car Park does not seem to have enough for all the rooms.  We were lucky to find a space as someone was leaving but we saw quite a few cars illeagally parked but what can you do if you need to stay there.  Perhaps they have

Summary: We chose this hotel because of a sale on Hotels.com and because it was within walking distance to Downtown Disney.   The staff was very nice and the check-in/out process is very fast.  The room is nice and clean as well.

Summary: This was better than I expected by far. For being so big, it was very quiet. Breakfast was crazy fun. Busy everyday we were there. There are 2 pools and 3 hot tubs to choose from. And you will be within walking distance to Disney, saving you money on a rental car.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but location issues and waste practices?
Summary: Stayed here August 2019.  First, the positives:  The pool area was very nice for a mid-range hotel - two larger pools, two jacuzzis and a children's dipping pool as well as lots of places to sit.  The breakfast quality was good. Hot breakfast - eggs, meat, pastries, fruit. Very crowded, but we never had trouble with the table.  Front-desk service was very good and accommodating.  Room, while a bit dated, was okay.  Negatives:  I was really concerned about the waste generated at breakfast. There was no mixed waste containers for recycling or compost. EVERYTHING went in the trash. Now, I suppose they can say they sort it all out after, but they certainly don't state that. It felt really really depressing to be throwing everything from apple cores to paper plates to plastic

Summary Heading: Dark & dingy but in good location
Summary: The hotel looks reasonable from the outside, the reception area is nicely presented and the staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are dark and dingy. Even with the curtains open you don't get much light in as the window looks out onto the passageway which is covered, and you have to have net curtains to stop people from looking in! The decor is also very dark making this worse and although the room was cleaned daily I wasn't convinced it was actually clean as I couldn't see it properly! The air conditioning smelt really bad and had a clean filter light coming on so we couldn't use it the first night, this was reported and fixed the next day so we could put the AC on, but it was so noisy we couldn't sleep with it on at night. We were also disturbed by the noise from something

They have a laundry which is very handy! Can get crowded so get in early to do Washing! Also have vending machines around the hotel which is handy. When we arrived they gave us a breakfast card, can get crowded. Unfortunately we didn‚Äôt get to use the pool, but seemed like a great little area. Overall a lovely well priced hotel, will be recommending to people i know if they go to Disneyland!  Thank you!

Summary: Very nice. Had complimentary breakfast with actual food, not just donuts and coffee. Salt water pools and hot tubs.  Free parking. Easy to get in and out. Not luxury accommodations but very clean and quiet. Great place for families. Bonus- home to a Disneyland cat!

Summary: Stayed here for a Disneyland trip, mainly due to the price point compared to the outrageous Disneyland hotels. It is very close to the parks, about a 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney - so the location is perfect.  Breakfast was OK - above average, but just nuts with all the families, etc.  Would highly recommend as a great value hotel close to the parks.

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights to visit Disneyland and our expectations were exceeded greatly.  The hotel is a pleasant walk to Disneyland and also has a few restaurants within easy walking distance also.  Rooms are motel style - a little small but perfectly serviceable with fridge and microwave- no in room safe though.  We found staff very pleasant and were able to check in early.  The breakfast that was included was also excellent - go early though as it does get busy, but there is plenty of hot choices and it was tasty.    What was perhaps the most pleasant surprise was the pool area - which was never overly busy.  Two large pools and 2 hot tub spas and plenty of seating.  They also show movies poolside in the evening which was a great touch.  Do not hesitate to book this hotel

Summary: So glad we tried this place. We loved the large countertop for getting ready since we were 3 women and all had enough space. The room was good sized and clean. The breakfast was amazing and we are super picky. Fresh, good variety and lots of it. We loved the chorizo and eggs with tortillas available the 1st morning. I thought the location was ideal. Even though we were exhausted by the end of a very long day at the park we just had a 10-15 minute walk and we were back in our room. Other places we have stayed we wait in a HUGE line for the shuttle to the Toy Story parking lot and then still had to walk a bit more there and drive back to the hotel. Plus had to pay $25 to park there! We loved this hotel. I will definitely return!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary Heading: Great location for a Disneyland visit
Summary: Convenient location; a 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney. Close enough to return to the hotel to eat or swim and return back to the park.   We booked a double queen room for 3 people. Aside from the odor of marijuana, the room was clean and had a microwave and small fridge.   The breakfast was decent with ingredients to make breakfast sandwiches; English muffins, egg patties, sausage patties, ham slices, cheese, etc. Other options like cereal, toast, pastries and yogurt.

Location is great too, just a couple blocks away from Downtown Disney, and 15 min walk to the parks. Summary: Did 4 nights here while visiting Disneyland and California Park. Rooms pretty small for 2 adults and 2 teenagers, dated decor but functional. Summary Heading: Great place to stay with a few hiccups
Summary: Me and my family stayed at BW for two nights. check in/check out was a breeze. Room was clean although our fridge wasn't workin . I switch it to another outlet and that solved the issu . GRAs were very nice and kept our room clean and loaded us up with fresh towels the next day.   The free breakfast is good but the lack of seating should be addressed. we couldn't find anywhere to sit and enjoy our breakfas .   My main issue was parking or should I say the lack of it. I came with two vehicles and I couldn't get a parking pass for my second one. I had to pay $60 to park my vehicle at the GardenWalk parking structure. Oh and they charge for parking at the hotel as well ($10 a day if you're a guest). Next time I'll just find another hotel with better parking and avoid that issue

Summary Heading: Kids feet were black on the bottom from walking around on the carpet in our hotel room!
Summary: Check-in was smooth, staff were efficent, the pool was kept well, breakfast was satisfying.  The best location to Disney and Convention Center. In reality they make you choose a one-hour time frame when you check in and then you're supposed to only have breakfast during that time each day. So effectively for you there's only a one-hour breakfast window. The breakfast quality was also not great. The organisation of a schedule for the breakfast is not a bad idea but that needs a controle. So many people were not satisfied and went to the breakfast room at a convenient time for theimselves so it was very hard to find a table available. Don't expect to sleep after 7Am and before 10:30PM because of NOISE.

Summary: The room at this hotel is so dated and dreary i found it instantly depressing when we walked in, brown everywhere.  Also, we were greeted with a terrible smell. Summary Heading: Close to DLand and Free Breakfast
Summary: Nice room and pretty much all you need if you're going to Disneyland. I like to stay in places with a free breakfast so that we can save at least get in a good meal before heading to the park. Nice choice of items and staff was really good.   Only downside for the stay is that this is an older style hotel with the rooms facing outdoors. This means you hear all sorts of noise from the parking lot. But if you're just going to need a place to get some sleep between midnight and 7 am before heading back to the park, this will take care of you nicely.   Lobby staff was also very helpful.  You have to know what you're getting. This will be a hotel with a lot of families all excited to go to the park. This is not a spot for a romantic getaway.

The hotel has two pools and hot tubs which for the most part are not too busy overall. One good heads up I can tell you is if you want a room on the ground floor directly across from the pool ask for a room from 440 up to 450.  They are directly across.        The hotel has a half decent free breakfast buffet , which makes up for the 10 dollar a day parking charge.  Still very fair when you consider parking elsewhere. Summary Heading: What are you looking for in a hotel?
Summary: Personally, I loved this hotel. It met my needs.  The rooms are very dated. It is a motel style hotel, with all of the hallways on the outside. For the most part the rooms were really clean, but like I said, pretty dated. The hotel is walking distance, a slight trek. But totally doable. Breakfast is included with the room. And it is a really fantastic breakfast with tons of options and fruit to grab and take with you into the park. Go early for breakfast, because it gets packed.  The hotel is out on the main street so there is a CVS, Walgreens, Gas Station, and a few restaurants nearby, all walking distance.  They also had a fantastic new pool area that includes two pools, and three hot tubs and plenty of sitting.  We will definitely try and stay again on our next Disney trip.

Summary Heading: Good value hotel, walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Our family of four, plus my mom, stayed at the Best Western Plus Stovall's Inn.   We had two adjoining rooms.   The rooms were quiet and comfortable.   The breakfast had a good selection of hot and cold items, plenty to stock up before a big day at the parks.   The walk was about 10 minutes to the security entrance at downtown Disney and then another 10 minutes to the entrances of the parks.   It was too far away to go back for a quick rest in the middle of the day...especially if you were tired enough to need a rest...but worked well for us since we were all old enough to not need naps anymore.   Certainly the value of this hotel was worth the 20 minute walk.   I would stay again and recommend to other families.

Summary: My first trip to Disneyland and I'm glad I stayed here. It was a great experience all around. Got a good price for the location and a shuttle to take you to and from Disneyland, which after all that walking the shuttle is a saving grace at the end of the day! The breakfast buffet included is good and has a good variety to choose from. The rooms were clean. The only thing I didn't like were the bathrooms were a bit small and saw a few mosquitoes in the bathroom. But the customer service was good and I had no issues while there. It is a very convenient location and I slept well at night because the place and area felt secure.

Summary: Stayed Feb 26 - March 3. I'm okay with walking a lot so I felt that this hotel was great proximity to Disney. I only ate at the breakfast buffet once but felt it was a very good selection for free breakfast. There were two pools which was nice, we didn't feel crammed in the hot tub. I would definitely recommend this place for people going to Disney. It could be a little too much walking for children if they have been walking in the parks all day. It took my boyfriend and I about ten minutes to walk from the hotel to Downtown Disney. I will definitely stay here again during my next Disney trip in Anaheim.

Summary: We got a great rate, going during the middle of the week.   Check in was quick, they do sell Disney tickets, but only two days and up. Summary: We have stayed at a lot of BW hotels. We've stayed here 2 times, and I like this hotel for the rate, the location, the updated and clean-smelling rooms and the breakfast selection. However this last stay left me with mixed feelings. We received maid service on the first day but not the second or third. On the second day, I went out to the maid cart to get more towels and the maid closed the door in front of me. I got the feeling that they didn't really want to clean our room (or give us more towels.)  By the night of the third day, we had a pile of wet towels on the bathroom floor and an overflowing garbage can. If it were one day, I'd let it fly. Or if I were there by myself. But two days without maid service for a room with multiple people makes me unhappy.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, great breakfast and pools
Summary: This hotel is a great value option for Disneyland. Very clean and well equipped rooms, lovely clean and big pool area, and amazing full breakfast included! Takes about 10 - 15 mins to walk to Disneyland main gates, along a very nice boulevard and past the Disneyland hotels. There is a local shuttle (for a small fee) that stops right in front of the hotel and the hotel sells tickets, if you don't feel like walking. A couple of decent restaurants are within a 1 or 2 minute walk. Check-in, housekeeping and breakfast room staff were very friendly and professional. No in-room safe - that would be a nice addition, but they do have complimentary safe deposit boxes at the front desk.

Summary Heading: Good value for a family if you spend the day at Disney and not at a motel - easy walk to Disney
Summary: Stovall's has been there forever - it seems.   I commented to the desk staff about how the reception area's decor reminded me of the late sixties, and they said that many features were original from 1968 (and in excellent condition).   Ah, that was a more innocent time, yes?  And it was certainly a different Disneyland as well... but this review is about Stovall's, and it's a good review.  Stovall's is an old property, but it's been renovated.   Most rooms have two full or queen sized beds. It's a bit tight, but I've had and seen far less spacious accommodations. There's a separate room for shower and commode with the sink in the room for all to use.  At one time the property probably had an exposed clothing / coat rack - but it's been replaced by an armoire.  Rooms have a small

Summary: Called Best Western Stovalls in Anaheim to cancel because the storm was going to hit on Friday night (the night of our stay).  They say that they have a 48 hours cancellation policy (when most hotels let you cancel up to a few hours before you are due to arrive). on top of losing the voucher money, they are charging my CC with taxes for the room.  I told them that I made the reservation with a MILITARY voucher, they don't care. I could not use the voucher for another day, because I was cancelling with less than 48 hours.   We have been a reward members with Best Western for years, but now since they don't care about MILITARY people, we wont stay with them anymore. Please if you care about military personnel, don't stay with them.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We actually have a great relationship with the Military and offer them the lowest rate throughout the year to show our appreciation. Because the rate is so low we have a strict cancel policy of 48hrs. which applies to all reservations made at the hotel. I understand that the reason for cancellation was because of the storm but we cannot make exceptions for weather. Since the weather in California is very unpredictable.  Thank you once again for your review and please feel free to contact us if you need any further information.

The included breakfast was quite good. If we go back we'll likely try to for a hotel closer to the park.

Summary: Gave this two stars for the following:  walking distance to Disneyland parks, and the front desk staff was very friendly.  It stops there.  The room smelled bad, there was mold on the ceiling in the bathroom, the bath towel I used had 7 holes in it (one rather large), the bathroom door was dirty and didn't close all the way.  The breakfast was abysmal.  You could have bounced the scrambled eggs on the ground.  The fresh fruit (bananas) were so green they were inedible. Although there were staff members there, the tables weren't getting cleaned as they passed by them.   I know that because of its proximity to the park that the rates were going to be on the high side, but I expect more from a motel that charges two hundred bucks a night than what we got. Would not stay again.

Summary: This hotel was nice! I would definitely recommend this hotel for everyone. If no rooms are available they still let you park in the hotel which is great! They offer shuttle tickets to the park, which is also at a great price! Better than paying at the park for parking! Me and my family stayed in a 2 bed room, the beds were a little to small for me and my husband I believe they were a full size beds and I'm use to either a queen or king. So definitely if your sharing a bed you might want to get a room with a queen or king beds for sure! The maintenance was well kept! The breakfast area was amazing. Summary: What can I say more? The Staff is very accommodating, even asking if there is a certain room I wanted, the rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable enough, there is a microwave and mini fridge. There are connecting rooms for larger families. And the breakfast is better than I have at home--because I don't have to do the dishes. the swimming area is so nice, if it isn't busy (which usually the people are all at Disneyland) you can have your won cabana!  I love it when I come back from a full day and my room is magically clean! And the walk to Disneyland really isn't that bad.  Just one suggestion , though...maybe it would be nice if the parking spaces were reserved for the room in front of them?

Summary: This was one of the worst hotel experiences we have had. Even the one car we were allowed to park had to be out by 3 p.m. to avoid paying a fine - so this hotel is no good at all if you were hoping to go to Disneyland for the day! The hotel staff was surly and didn't offer solutions. In general, the hotel felt incredibly unfriendly. Inside the room, instead of a sign welcoming us and wishing us a nice stay, there was a sign threatening to charge us if we stole anything!  Then on top of everything else - the beds were very bouncy and uncomfortable, and we didn't sleep well at all.

Just cut through the grand Californian entrance to get there quicker (less than 10 mins). Parking was free with the room, as was breakfast so an economical choice for families without sacrificing comfort.

They also sell tickets for the park and there is a shuttle (for a charge) that can take you back and forth from the park to the hotel.  Other than that, this is the usual Best Western...not a luxury resort, but well kept, clean and reliable!

Summary: We spent a week exploring southern California. Disneyland, SanDiego and Santa Monica. We set up base at the Best Western Plus Stovall's Inn.  If you are planning to visit Disneyland it's within an easy walk to the entrance through the Grand Disney Hotel and Downtown Disney. It was an easy of enough walk for the little kids as well. (they did wave it) Also, once we parked and arrived in our room, a note on the table said that we had to park in another parking lot because early next morning lot was being resurfaced.  It was late in evening when we arrived at hotel.  And we were very tired. But we had no choice but to go back out, walk to the other parking lot on other side of building to move the car. Booking has this place at 8.8/10 which is why I booked it but Yelp has it at 3.5/5 which if I had read, I would not have booked.  Parking $10 per night stay and includes in and out privileges. Summary Heading: Close and convenient to Disneyland. That's all you need.
Summary: This place is about as close as you  can get to the main Disneyland entrance and downtown Disney, without staying at one of the parks hotels. It is a very close walk.  The breakfast is unremarkable, but there are quite a number of options and it is included in the room rate, so we don't complain!  The rooms themselves are very basic. We had two queen beds which fit the four of us very well. Nothing fancy but the rooms are clean and there is very minimal noise which is very surprising given how many families are coming and going and given its proximity to the Katella Street.  I would definitely recommend this to families who are planning on visiting Disneyland every day. Otherwise, there is really no reason to be in this area!

Summary Heading: Staff was nice, finishes a bit worn
Summary: Imagine, if you will, a 1950-60s era multi-story Motor Lodge.  Okay, now without changing the footprint of the rooms, including a window in the shower out to a courtyard, imagine a 2000-something update.    Everything worked (the microwave was a bit meh and the shower came on by pulling the temperature handle -- but there is no guidance to do so until you call the front desk) and was reasonably clean it just wasn't to our tastes.  The staff was largely pleasant to deal with.  The breakfast buffet was hit or miss -- the starch better than the proteins.  And it was a bit of a walk to Downtown Disney.  But it is also on the ART line (9) which will take you to the other side of the park entrances from Downtown Disney.

Summary Heading: Great Disney location - watch out for parking charges
Summary: I was in Anaheim for a conference at the convention center.  This location is an easy walk to the convention center and a reasonable price given the proximity to Disneyland.  Parking, at $10 per day, is a bargain, except that the parking ends at 3pm on the day you check out.  It's $10 per HOUR on that last day.  My conference didn't end until 4pm.  Pulling out of the lot at 4:10 pm cost an additional $20, so parking can get very expensive!  A plentiful breakfast is included and it was crowded in the breakfast room at 7am and 8am, but they kept the buffet refreshed so there was always a good selection including hot eggs and bacon or sausage and potatoes.

The hotel offers a breakfast and has a pool and spa. Mini gift shops and vending machines. Right next door to Cocos and close to other dining facilities. Next trip I will stay here again.

The manager tried to blame ME, saying I had made "like eight reservations with eight different booking companies"...when in fact I DID NOT. I had one other reservation that was cancelled, and have documents to prove it. If the area hadn't been completely booked up, I would have left and gone somewhere else. ANYWHERE else. Summary: We have stayed at Stovall's Inn 5 times now. It is our #1 go to hotel for our annual Disneyland trip. The breakfast room has been updated in the past year. It is beautiful, with many new options. The grounds & hotel are immaculately kept. Our room is always VERY clean & in good order. The added bonus is that Coco's restaurant is next door to get a late dinner after we're done at the park. On this trip we discovered the tram (small bus) that stops literally in front of the hotel every 20 minutes & takes you directly to the park for $3. We will make better use of it on our next trip. it really saved my feet on the 3rd & 4th days at Disneyland. Truly this is the best value & convenience in Disneyland hotels.

Summary Heading: Only stay for a quick Disneyland visit.
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights. We were out of the hotel most of the time, spending one night at Knotts Berry Farm and then two full 13 hour days at Disneyland. I would only stay here if you are planning on doing a similar thing, not for an extended stay where you are planning to relax and spend time in the hotel. The rooms were fairly clean but very small. They were extremely dark, with insufficient lighting and only one small window at the front of the room under the balcony which meant not much light came through it. If you want privacy you need to have the curtain closed too, and the dark furniture, carpet, walls and fixtures make it feel even smaller and darker. We were also given two King single beds even though we are a couple. It is an easy 15 minute walk to get to Downtown

Summary Heading: Clean, friendly, fairly priced and a 10 minute walk from Disney
Summary: Loved this hotel.  The check in took awhile as the hotel is clearly always packed with eager Disney tourists, but once in the room, it was spacious, spotlessly clean and very comfortable.   We had a great third floor room that was nice and quiet, with a great view of the DCA park and the nightly fireworks at Disney.   There is a very nice pool setup at the hotel, a couple bigger pools, a couple hot tubs and a kiddies pool.  All in excellent shape, with plenty of lounge chairs and cabanas to sit and unwind after a crazy day at Disney.  The morning breakfast was packed every day, but it is a very solid offering, with numerous hot and cold selections, and enough room to soak up the flood of folks that come in to fuel up prior to heading to Disney. The breakfast room (while extremely crowded) had a fantastic spread and a full hot and cold selection including eggs, ham, sausage, French toast, oatmeal etc. Ate at different times from 7 to 10 and never really found a quiet time. Summary: Checked in as planned and while we hoped to get in early, we were told our room wasn't ready.  That's fine, we went to the Park, came back tired and ready for a shower.  Did a quick check of the room only to find a dirty sock in the corner, and the carpet had not been vacuumed.  Housekeeping came and did a quick clean up and off they went.  The menu for the Room service was not updated so when we ordered from Coco's (the restaurant that supplies the room services) the bill was more than it should have been.  When we complained, Coco's told us the hotel had the wrong menus and that the prices were not updated.  They did give us a free piece of pie as an apology.  Overall the hotel was ok, breakfast was good and it is very close to the Park.

Summary: Had a lovely stay here for the first part of our honeymoon, they so kindly upgraded us to a king room on the top floor with a great view of the disneyland fireworks. Very close to disney and on the art bus route, stop is directly outside hotel. Lots of neighbouring restaurants.  Breakfast included is basic but hey its free and fills the gap. Pool area kept clean and is a good size, plenty of towels, sun loungers etc Will definitly stay again

Summary: I clicked on the wrong one when I rated... sorry this is the hotel we stayed at.. reasonable, clean, larger rooms, friendly staff, this one is gated so no other ppl can be lingering around... you need the key. One thing that happened I will share:  A little girl wondered out of the room maybe 3 years of age... someone found her outside, brought her to the front desk- the police was called and stayed until parent came back to the room from the park. whoever was in the room wouldn't come to the door... I was checking in at the time and stayed in  a room close to the ppl so I saw them return to the room... thankfully the staff is prepared for

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, Low Budget Hotel
Summary: We were visiting Disneyland for 2 days only and did not want to spend an exorbitant amount on hotels inside Disneyland. This was a budget hotel, neat and clean, sumptuous breakfast included and has $5 bus pick up & drop (all day) to Disneyland, in case you don't want to walk 10-15 minutes. Number of local restaurants nearby will deliver food to the room. Kids loved the pool. No bell boys. We had to take our luggage to the room.

Summary Heading: Excellent Stay For a Great Price

Summary: Stayed one night and everything was as expected from other reviews and photos. Room and bath was clean and bed was firm. Front desk staff friendly and welcoming. Nice pool area but adjacent to busy street, so hard to feel like you're at a resort (of course you're not). But good room, free breakfast, walking distance to Downtown Disney and sufficient parking will mean I'd return for a short stay again.

Summary Heading: This hotel is an excellent choice!
Summary: We had a great experience at this hotel..The front staff are extremely helpful and friendly (with a good sense of humor too!)  A short 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland.  The breakfast has a great selection of both hot and cold choices so there is adequate choices for everyone.  From eggs/bacon/ham/sausage/hash browns/French toast/fresh fruit/yogurt/toast/cereals/oatmeal/juices/coffee/donuts....the pool area is soooo nice after a long day at Disney.  You can sit out there and watch the fireworks at night.  The rooms are very clean, shower head was exceptionally nice with good pressure.   I would recommend this hotel for sure!  The price was good and location is great.  We are planning a return visit next year already.

Summary Heading: Good value hotel within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for 9 nights in August. The proximity to Disney and the price were our two considerations when booking. Plus the fact that breakfast was included in the price. The room was not as good as the BW Plus Bayside in San Diego where we had come from, but it was adequate for our needs. The A/C was very noisy and we could not have it on at night due to the noise. The room was always cleaned to a good standard. Breakfast was a bit manic on some days. The first day we were surprised at how many people were there and thought we may have to eat standing up but we did get a table. There was a good choice of cooked items, pastries, cereal, breads, juice and other beverages. It was all self service and kept well stocked. The staff were all very helpful.  I think we would stay

Summary: Our 2nd stay for a Run Disney event. Great place to stay! You can walk to Disney from here day or night as the sidewalks are lit and safe. Free and tasty breakfast with lots of choices even for a vegetarian. Quiet with comfortable beds.

Summary Heading: We LOVED Stovall's Best Western Plus!
Summary: If you are planning a trip to Disney in Anaheim, this is the place to stay. Friendly staff, very clean rooms, wide selection of items at the continental breakfast and a local shuttle that runs every half hour from the front door to Disneyland. Although, the park is close enough to walk to. The pools are clean and a nice little family restaurant is located on the premises as well. We were traveling to Disney with young kids and the kids loved this hotel for the beautiful palm trees, great breakfast, pool and cute topiary shrubs. We also had two elderly members of our party with some mobility issues but the restaurant and pools were an easy walk from the rooms for them. The elevators also ran great so they never needed to climb stairs.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay, but NO wash cloths two days running?
Summary: Room was comfortable enough. Clean, and everything in good working order.Room is a bit small, and the bathroom door opens inward, which is a problem if you are using the bathroom. I went to the front desk, but it was 1:00 a.m. and they could not get me any wash cloths. We thought surely the next day that wouldn't be the case, but sure enough, there were no wash cloths again. Fortunately, we found one that we neglected to put with the dirty towels and we all shared that. (four people, one wash cloth... not fun.) The clerk at the desk comped us a night of parking. Summary Heading: Clean Hotel, Soft Beds and walking distance to Disneyland!
Summary: We needed a hotel close to the park for 3 nights in June as we were doing a family vacation. They had a full breakfast, and items we could grab on the go so we had something to eat in line at Disney, over all decent food. Maybe a half mile from the park.   Rooms where clean, we were close to the road, and it was surprisingly quiet. We also liked that there was a Marie Calendars next door, as we were able to buy a pie for a dessert that night. They had a pool which looked nice, but we didn't have the time.   Probably one of the better priced hotels that we could find and I would stay there again if we do this type of a trip again. We were very happy with our stay.

Like that is is both hot and cold food(scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs.) nice and close to park.  Rooms quiet. Only hear people if walking by room. Summary: We stayed for 6 nights at the start of our holiday in California. The staff were welcoming & had us checked in quickly. The rooms were of a good size & clean. The free breakfast was a great extra benefit as it saved us spending money at Disney, but could be very busy at times. The swimming pool was well used by our child & we even sat & watched a movie in the evening while swimming. The walk to Disneyland is very straight forward & took no effort at all. Always managed to get a parking space, though it got quite busy at times.  I would have liked there to be in-room safes, rather than the safety deposit boxes at reception & also somewhere to sit & buy drink in the evening.

Summary Heading: A disappointing stay - not as good as other hotels in the area
Summary: The check-in process was great, as were all of the staff that we encountered.  What was at issue were:  a cockroach in our room, a breach of security of our room at midnight - when someone opened our door - luckily the security bolt/lock was in place - and also mysterious bites on my ankles which I believe were bed bugs!  The breakfast was adequate but for the amount of people partaking of this meal, what a mess people can make!  Really shows how rude and thoughtless the general public can be.  Again, the staff were wonderful but the beds were extremely hard and the pillows were like puffed wheat!  Not what we are used to for a 2.5 hotel . . .  I don't think we'd stay here again, even with the free breakfast!

Only gross thing was that there was hairs and dust around the toilet! Who knows how long that's been there for. It was quite annoying to find out that their hotel policy is one car per room. It was really inconvenient for us due my family and I came in two different cars. They said we couldn't park one of our cars on their property. I had to take my car to a parking garage past harbor street and they charged me quite a bit there for my car. After complaining to the young unprofessional

Summary Heading: good hotel for a good price!
Summary: We visit Disneyland twice a year and have stayed in this hotel the majority of the time. The price is always decent and the location is good. We were first referred here by our travel agent. Its about a 10-15 minute walk to Downtown Disney and 20 minutes to the parks. If you have smaller children I highly recommend bringing or renting a stroller (can't take the ones from Disney out of the park) by the end of the day the kids are exhausted and the hike back is tough without a stroller (my kids were 3 and 5).  My only complaint had nothing to do with the hotel but its location, there wasn't enough restaurants and grocery stores close by.   Also the Disney Express does not drop off/pick up  directly at hotel but across the road at the Anabella, which isn't a huge deal but can be

Summary: The check in process was fast and simple! They were very accommodating!  They had a shuttle service to Disneyland ($5.00) but it's worth it.  It's not that far. Much better than walking when you are exhausted.  The breakfast was great!  Never knew about this hotel before.  Will definitely be going back!

Summary: We had a King room and were shocked to see the quality and cleanliness of this hotel. All rooms have been renovated, pool area is stunning, and the free breakfast was far beyond our expectations (although the eating area can be super busy).
