Summary: Hello All,  We just came back from a 2 night stay at Best Western Stovall's Inn and I must say I had a great time.  The hotel looks just like the photos to our relief.  The beds were comfy and the room had a great amount of storage for us.  We had a room on the 1st floor next to the breakfast hall which I must say was great as well (yummy pancake style eggs, sausage and fresh toast, bagels, danishes, cereal and pancakes with all the fixing for you to dive into).  There was also plenty of seating space for breakfast but we opted to take our food back to the room for breakfast in bed.  The room was not noisy like you would expect being right across from Disney's California Adventure so we had a great nights sleep. They have a exercise room that looks nice but we did not get a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your business. I‚Äôm glad that you had a wonderful time here with us. Starting your day with a nice breakfast and then heading over to the park and having a wonderful time there. You get to come back and sleep in our comfy beds.  We hope you come back and visit us again!

Summary Heading: Just one step short of excellent
Summary: The hotel looks fairly new or recently renovated. Nice big rooms with fairly new furniture, carpets, etc. Very clean, nice comfy beds and very quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very conveniently located next to Disney parks, no more than a 10 minute walk. The rates are quite reasonable for being this close to Disney but they charge a bit more on weekends. They have 4 computers in the lobby as opposed to the normal 1 most places have. The only drawback to this place is the free breakfast. The food is only ok and the room is very small. It seems to be always packed and closes at 9:30. Most need to bring the food back to their rooms. If the breakfast area was expanded and the food was better, I'd rate this place as excellent. I would still recommend this
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time on letting us know on how your stay was. We appreciate your business. I will let the staff know on what a great job they are doing. Yes, we are only a 10-15 minute walk to the Disneyland and Grand California Parks through Downtown Disney. The breakfast room can sometimes be a bit busy. We do have tables and chairs located on the outside of the breakfast room if you desire to eat outside. We hope that when visiting the Anaheim area you will come and stay with us. We hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: It is very good comparing to other inns
Summary: The room was clean, breakfast was good compared with other inns.  The price is reasonable.  There was no slippers.  (Even on demand!)  Staff was weird because we asked them about near restaurant and after we left they laughed and I don't know why!  Air conditioner was old and broken.  Bath was very clean and in nice condition.  Bed was uncomfortable.  Hotel is near downtown disneyland and it takes about 5-10 minutes to go there.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your business. I do apologize we don‚Äôt have any slippers to give out to the guest‚Äôs. We are in transition of changing out old AC units. We do have a walking dinning map for your convenience. I will let housekeeping know that they are doing a great job on the rooms. Thank you again and we hope to see you soon!

Summary: This one came free with our airfares, but it was great for us.  Staff were extremely helpful, room was a pretty good size, with tea & coffee making.  Two basic restaurants next door, and bus stop outside in the street.  Within walking distance to Disneyland - but the bus is only $2 for the return trip.  Also easy bus trip a few blocks up to watch the Anaheim Angels play (baseball) at Anaheim Stadium.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time on your review. We appreciate your business. I‚Äôm glad that you loved our hotel and that you had a great stay. Yes, you are able to take the city transit to the Anaheim Stadium. We have directions to any attraction that you want to go to. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: My husband and I just got back from a three night stay at the Stovall's Inn yesterday,  The  rooms are clean and tidy and housekeeping is very attentive.  Beds were pretty comfy.  I was most impressed by how I always saw the staff working on the property.  The property is secure and within walking distance (2+ blocks) from the Grand Californian entrance to California Adventure.   The breakfast was lacking with soggy waffles and strange eggs, but I would recommend CoCos next door.  If you're there on a Sunday, go to the brunch at the Storyteller's Cafe at the Grand Californian.  Great food and a real treat for both adults and kids, as the Disney characters visit you at the table.  Overall, a good experience.  I would stay there again in a pinch.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate you letting us know how we are doing. I will definitely let housekeeping know what a GREAT job they are doing. We do get a lot of compliments on our comfy beds. It is a short 10-15 min. walk to the Grand Californian Hotel and the California Adventure Park. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: Spent 4 nights here while visiting Disneyland, Universal studios and Knotts berry farm.  Location is pretty spot on, walking distance to Disney and maybe 45 mins to airport alowing for LA traffic.  Quite a large hotel popular with families.  Our room was spotless and the bed was just the most comfortable ever! We had a room with adjoining doo and there were a couple of times when the noise from the next door was a bit disturbing so maybe try to avoid if possible.  Breakfast was included, toast, cereral, scrambled egg and pancakes etc..but the dining area can get pretty busy with all the families getting ready for days out.  They have free internet and a pool and a small gym if you have not done enough walking round Disney.  Staff were all quite helpful.  Decent restaurant next
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your business. I‚Äôm glad that you had a great time. Sometimes the breakfast room does get a little crowded. That‚Äôs great that you enjoyed the breakfast we offer. We hope to see you again.

Summary: April 6-10, 2012 we stayed for Easter. My sister and her 8 year old and me and my 9 year old. The room was clean, great beds, comfortable and nice bathroom, there was a microwave and fridge, so that was nice! Our door was hard to get the key to open since it's a much traveled area being so close to Disney but after a few tries it always worked! The BREAKFAST WAS WONDERFUL!!! Pre made waffles, eggs and sausage links as well as cereal and yogurt, fruit, rolls, bagles and breads... juice's , coffee and tea... we enjoyed it and even took a few back to the room for snack time. We also eat several times at the resturant next door that had pool side service. The pools had one COL pool and one warm pool, a kiddie pool and two hottubs!! For the price includes breakfast of a moderate
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for your review. I‚Äôm very pleased to hear that you had a great time here at the Stovall‚Äôs Inn. I do apologize if the door wasn‚Äôt working for you. I hope we were able to assist in this matter. Thanks for the compliment of the breakfast. That‚Äôs great that you were able to enjoy the pools and pool side service. We hope to see you again!

Summary: Overall this wasn't a bad place to stay especially for the location to Disney and the convention center and the price. However , the breakfast was nasty! The area was tiny for the amount of families.  the food was the same everyday(cold square eggs, greasy sausage,and soggy waffles) out of most items most of the time and it was dirty. Trash over flowing, tables weren't wiped and floors were sticky and loaded with food. I understand they were busy but a quick clean isn't difficult. We ate there twice out of our five days.   The pool was great. Fully stocked with towels ALL of the time and clean. Our room was nice, clean and fairly quiet.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I do apologize if the breakfast room was not kept up and the trash was full. I will let the breakfast staff know about this so they pay close attention to these details. I will also mention to them that the food was cold. That‚Äôs great that you did get a chance to enjoy the pools. I will let housekeeping know that they are doing a great job keeping the pools stocked up with towels. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: As a Best Western Plus I was expecting a little bit more.  This was nice for a motel but as a Plus property I was expecting a lower end hotel.  The room was alright.  Older furnishings and old box style television.  We were on the third floor which was nice and helped cut down on the noise from the other guests.  The floor was squeaky and every time we walked past the end of the bed the entire dresser/entertainment center shook.  There was no closed but there was a wardrobe that was awkwardly  placed in the room which made it nearly impossible to get to the mini fridge and microwave.  The room and the property were clean.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  Easy walk to the parks.  Breakfast in the morning was very busy.  The staff did their best to keep the eating area clean
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time on the review. We appreciate your business. Part of our remodel is to change out the old TV's with new flat screens. We will try and be more efficient on attending the breakfast room. We hope when visiting the Anaheim area you will stay with us again!

Summary: You really couldn't ask for anything much closer to Disneyland. You can see California Adventure right across the street, you could definitely walk if you wanted.  Honestly, I think it's overpriced as far as the actual accommodations and amenities. I didn't like having to pay for parking, but I understand why they have to charge. Room was clean-ish... there were some crumbs or something on the floor when we walked in, but the beds looked ok. They were kind of hard, but we were all so tired it didn't really matter. Not sure if I would stay here again. I think I would rather pay 30 bucks more and stay at the Hilton Garden Inn or something, but it worked for a single night.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I will let housekeeping know to check the rooms more thoroughly and to make sure they are ready for our guest's to check in. We hope you give us another try to give you superior service. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: The rooms are a nice size and the beds are very comfortable.  They have adjoining rooms for families, the front desk is very helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We hope you have a great time. We appreciate your comments and I will let the front desk know that they were very helpful. We hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Terrific for price and convenience, not luxury
Summary: Literally 2 blocks from the Anaheim Convention Center and maybe 4 blocks from Disney's front gate, you can walk to everything. The hotel is clean (however, many rooms allow smoking, so the permanent stench remains embedded in the curtains.)  The complimentary breakfast is good for traveler's on the go. There's a small gym. And the price was one of the lowest I found in this proximity at less than $150 per night.   Again, if you want amenities or romance or luxury, this is not the place. But if your on business and have meetings at the Convention Center or will be spending most all your day at the parks, this is the perfect spot. Also walking distance to downtown Disney, California Adventure and many, many restaurants in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your business. Yes, we are about a 5-10 min. walk to the Anaheim Convention Center and a 10-15 min. walk to the Main Gate of Disney through Downtown Disney. We do have about 10 smoking rooms located on the ground floor. We do have 3 elevators in the property. They are located in the middle of the hotel.  Any of our staff members could have point you to the nearest elevator. We hope to see you again!

Summary: Me and my brother's family started planning a family trip to Disneyland a year and a half ago. We looked at several properties and finally decided on Stovall's. We pre paid for the our rooms 6 months in advance which made our rate extremely affordable. The resort isn't fancy but has everything you need to enjoy your time in Disneyland. It is a short 10 min walk to downtown Disney. There are 2 pools and 2 hot tubs on site. The rooms are air conditioned and comfortable. Getting a free breakfast really helps save on food costs while at the park. The front desk service was great answered all of questions about car rentals and shuttles and the check in and out process was quick and easy. They have safe deposit boxes at the front desk so you can keep your passports and other items
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I‚Äôm very please to hear that you had a great time here. We have added more items in our continental breakfast for our guests to enjoy. It is a 10-15 walk to the Disney Park through Downtown Disney. You get to enjoy the scenery on your way over to the park. That‚Äôs great that you did get to enjoy the hot tub after a long day at the parks and being able to soak your tired feet. I will let all the staff know that they are doing a great job. We appreciate your business. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: We found this hotel because they allowed us to park our motor home. Not too many places allow a motor home. We did not want to stay at one of the RV parks. The staff was very accommodating and friendly, the grounds were immaculate. The rooms were clean, the location was great. Would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I‚Äôm glad that we were able to accommodate your motor home. Sometimes when we are busy we are not able to do so. We hope that you loved our hotel and when visiting the Anaheim area you will stay with us. Hope to see you guys again!

Summary Heading: A nice budget hotel on Disneylands doorstep
Summary: We stayed here for three nights in February 2011. The hotel overlooked the back of California Adventure Park and was perhaps a 5-10 minute walk to the main entrance of Disneyland.   The area itself is completely dedicated to Disneyland accomodation and needless to say, it is busy all the time. Stovall's Inn was a nice hotel, nothing fancy but perfect for families or travellers on a budget like ourselves. The staff were friendly and of course, you can easily purchase Disneyland tickets at the reception. From memory, I think we had to pay for parking which is a down side.   Our room was spacious, comfortable and clean with all the usual amenities. We did not spend much time in our room as we dedicated two full days to the parks which for a couple is plenty (would need more with a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time on your review. We appreciate your comments. We are located near the California Adventure Park. It‚Äôs a 10-15 walk to the parks through Downtown Disney. We have the Disneyland passes here available for our guest‚Äôs to purchase. I do apologize for not having the breakfast room stocked up at all times. I will mention that to the breakfast staff. We hope to see you again!

Summary: Great hotel for a bed and breakfast, everything was available, room was clean, amenities available, breakfast ok for a sit and go meal, internet kiosk for printing available free, bed were beautiful, slept like a baby, WiFi was ok at times, only downfall paying for parking!! All hotels I have been throughout USA offer free parking, but not this one, tv reception was terrible, still had analog units, rates are ok and affordable. Would come again...
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your business. People always compliment us on our beds. They say that it was the best sleep they have ever had. A lot of the properties are starting or have started charging for parking. My understanding is that we have the cheapest parking fee. All registered guest‚Äôs pay $8.00 per night. Non-guest‚Äôs pay the meter rate. I‚Äôm not sure if we were aware of the TV having bad reception. I hope we were able to assist you with this. Part of our upgrade is to get new flat screens in the rooms and this is something that is still occurring. We hope that when you come back we will have all flats in the property. We hope to see you guys again!

Summary: The location is the best part of the hotel.  It is exceptionally close to Disneyland park and you can enter California Andventure through a short cut through the Disney California hotel.  There is no need to take a shuttle as the walk is only 5 mins.  The rooms are clean and the pools are heated and nice. The breakfast is good but very busy in the mornings. Rooms are basic for 3 start hotel but the location and service are good. T
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your business. Yes, you can take a short cut through the Grand Californian Hotel. It‚Äôs a 5-10 min. walk to the main entrance from our property. I‚Äôm glad that you were able to enjoy the pools. I understand breakfast can be very busy in the mornings. Everyone is trying to leave early to start their day at the park. We hope to see you guys again!

Summary: Stayed here april1-3 for our Disney getaway. Room had a view of the backside of DCA & the fireworks show. We watched fireworks from the hot tub one night too. Our room was on the first floor #440. We had two Q beds. Room was a little tight with the beds and a table&chairs but enough room for 4 ppl & luggage. You don't stay in your room anyway. Room was clean and seemed to be updated. With the AC/ fan running at night, I couldn't hear any traffic. Never heard neighbors either and hotel was packed. Two pools, one heated,one not. Two hot tubs and one kiddie pool 1 1/2 ft deep. Pool towels too. Nice garden walkway next to pools with animal sculptured trees in it as well. Got our room thru get away today.com for $99/night. Parking was $8 a day but they couldn't get us a third floor
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your comments. I 'm very pleased to hear that you had a great time while staying with us. That's great that you were able to use the pools and enjoy the fireworks at night. We hope to see you guys soon!

Summary: We were looking for a place to stay at the last minute and Stovall's Inn was a nice place.   We like the fact that we could park our car near our room. There is an elevator but we prefer to use the stairs. We love the landscaping of animals around the pool area. And you can watch the fireworks from Disney everynight if you are facing the road. The airconditioning unit is an older type but it works.  Wifi is free and worked very well for us. There are two restaurants nearby and they are great if you need something to eat.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your comments. We do get a lot of compliments on our topiary garden. Yes, you can see the fireworks from the pool area. Part of our remodeling is to replace all old AC units for new ones. We do have free wifi for our guest‚Äôs. We are surrounded by all sorts of restaurants within walking distance. Hope to see you soon!

Summary: We were initially given a price and upon check-out, we were given a different, higher rate. This hotel was chosen over others since they had given us a lower rate than other hotels. At check-out, the initial "discount" we were given had returned to the original price (over 50% higher). When we talked to the manager (Liz) about this discrepancy, she was run about it and even resulted to calling us liars about the estimate. After she called and spoke with the person that had given us the first estimate, she came back with a lower price - it was not the same as our first estimate, but it was a lower price. We accepted this revised rate.  Also, the workers do not inform you about the parking rates. $8 per night, and you will be charged if you do not check out by 3pm. They do not
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time on your review. We appreciate your business. Let me start by apologizing for the whole confusion. It wasn‚Äôt our intention to make you feel that you were lying. We take this as a learning experience for all of us. While we are making reservations we do mention our parking fee of $8.00. The day of your departure the parking is good till 3pm anything past 3pm the parking meter takes over and it‚Äôs a $6.00 per hour parking fee. Parking can get a little crowded but if you need assistance finding a spot we can help you. There is a shuttle that you can take to Disneyland Park. It‚Äôs $4.00 per adult and kids ages 3-9 is $1.00. This is an all day pass for 1 day. We hope you give us another opportunity to serve you! Thank you again!

Summary: I reserved 2 rooms for 2 days for my families trip to Disneyland.  When I made the reservation I was given a AAA discount at one rate for the first day and a lower rate for the next.  During check-out I was charged the higher rate for both days.  I was told to call at a later time to speak with the manager.  I instead went back at a later time to speak with the manager in person.  the manager Liz told me that I had initially said $88 instead of $80 calling me a liar.  She made a call and eventually came back and gave me the rate at $88 dollars not the rate I was given initially but I did not argue and agreed with Liz.  When I exited and had to return to be let out of the gate Liz was bussy discussing my situaition with the other employees.  Horrible customer service.  Will not
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time on your review. We appreciate your business. Let me start by apologizing for the whole confusion. It wasn‚Äôt our intention to make you feel that you were lying. We do sometimes use certain issues that we have encountered for training purposes. We DON‚ÄùT make fun of any situation that we have with our guest‚Äôs. We try and learn from them and show our employees how to fix the problem. We take this as a learning experience for all of us. We hope you give us another opportunity to serve you!

Summary Heading: Good place for a night's sleep after Disneyland
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights on our Disneyland trip, I chose this hotel because of the location, breakfast, pools/hot tub, and price.  It is a short walk to Downtown Disney, we walked there and back twice each day without a problem. Took a much needed break in the hot tub and pool around mid afternoon- nobody was there except us which was nice. The rooms are nice, although on the small side.  The beds are small but comfortable.  The shower head didn't work properly but we made do.  The breakfast room was pretty crowded but they did a good job keeping it well stocked, there were enough choices to keep everyone happy. Tip: if you get in too early to check in, you can drive to Downtown Disney and park 3 hours for free, or 5 hours if you get your ticket validated by a restaurant/shop.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your business. We are a 10-15 min. walk through Downtown Disney. The breakfast room can be a little busy in the morning. The staff tries their very best to always have plenty of food. I do apologize that the showerhead was not working properly. I hope we were notified so we could have taken care of it. That‚Äôs great that you were able to park at Downtown Disney and get your ticket validated for that amount of hours. We hope to see you again!

Summary: We stayed here a few weeks ago during our 5 day Disneyland trip. Everything was clean, very well kept and the staff was top notch. Beds were comfy and the decor was trendy. Loved that the pool stayed open till 11pm and having two restaurants within a couple hundred feet of the hotel. Breakfast was always fresh and plentiful and the breakfast room was always clean and well stocked!! We did not find it too busy like others have posted. Lots of options to choose from, danishes, doughnuts, sausage, waffles, yogurt, toast, cold cereal, fruits, coffee/tea/cocoa. Scrambled eggs could use some work (weird form, pebble-like?) but I just chose not to eat them again during our stay. Only other complaints that I have is that we were unaware until our last day there was a shuttle available.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time on your review. We appreciate your comments. It can get busy in the breakfast room and we have added more tables outside for guest‚Äôs to enjoy their breakfast in the warm sun. I do apologize if you weren‚Äôt informed of the shuttle to Disneyland parks. The ART Transit is $4.00 per adult and $1.00 per child ages 3-9. I will make sure housekeeping checks the entire phone in the room before that give them out. We hope to see you again!

Summary: You couldn't ask for more with this hotel. The rooms were cleaned everyday to a very high standard with clean towels and fresh coffee and tea!! The pools were quite small but fine and only 10 minute walk to disney what more could you want. The only thing that let it down was the breakfast. Not much choice and when its gone its gone so go down early!!
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you on taking the time on your review. We appreciate your business and I do apologize for the inconvenience of the breakfast. I will let the staff know to make sure we are fully supplied till closing time. Thank you again and we hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Spacious, comfortable, family Accommodation within walking distance of Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at Best Western Stovall's Inn after the recommendations of several work colleagues who have stayed here (one of whom has stayed here for many years whenever they visit Disneyland - about every two years!).  We were very impressed with the rooms, service, and location, and have since recommended others to stay here too.  The rooms were spacious with two big queen sized beds, a flat screen television, a big cupboard for hanging clothing, another cupboard with drawers, and it also had a separate sink and mirror to the  bathroom which was perfect for a family staying in the same room as we didn't have to wait to use the sink if someone was having a shower etc!  There were two swimming pools, and two spa pools which we used every day were were there in the 8 nights we
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time on your review. We appreciate your business and we love the fact that you were able to use the pools. We have added more items to our breakfast. We now have yogurt, bagels, sausage and scrambled eggs. That‚Äôs great that you were able to take tours while you were staying with us. Yes, we do have a computer in the lobby that you are able to print your boarding passes. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights last summer for a visit to Disneyland. The hotel is just a short walk to the park. We ate breakfast on our last morning there, nothing fancy to write home about. Room was comfortable and served its purpose.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for staying with us. We are a 5-10 min walk to the parks through downtown Disney. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: We spent two nights here at the Stovall's Inn early on this month. Let me start off by saying that Michael at the front desk was wonderful, very polite which was refreshing after the not so friendliness I received from the front desk at check in. The breakfast was decent with hot options and two attendants who kept everything in stock which my family and I really appreciated.      I was a little nervous at first after reading the reviews regarding the walk to the Disneyland Parks but it was extremely pleasant- even lit with little twinkle lights in the trees and no more than 10 minutes away. We checked into taking the shuttle to the park and were very surprised to learn it costs an extra $4.00 a person each way- thankfully we enjoyed the walk so much that I am glad we decided
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Let me first apologize on behalf of the staff. We are here to give legendary service. It‚Äôs is a beautiful walk down to the parks. We hope that you will give us another chance to give Superior Customer Service. We hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Don't Stay Here If You Need Internet - The Management is Irresponsible
Summary: We came to a convention. We called ahead to make sure they had high speed internet and that we could be guaranteed a downstairs room due to health issues. Day after day the internet would not work. We were told by the night person Michael that it would be fixed the next day and never was. The manager Bill O'Connell admitted that there were internet problems every time there was a large convention especially the show we attended. On our 4th night he offered us a down stairs room in another section that "the internet should work". We did not have time to change rooms because we were there to do business. We asked him to let us leave a day early without charge and he refused. We lost lots of money and time by not having this important and promised utility and were led on day after
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay during the convention. As we discussed previously, our IT specialist was actively monitoring internet usage during the convention. Unfortunately, your computer continued have problems despite repeated attempts to solve the issue. We did in fact offer to move you and you declined. We credited your account due to spotty usage. Again, we apologize for not exceeding your expectations. We would welcome another opportunity to serve you during next years convention.

Summary: We spent 2 nights at the Stovalls in February 2012 to see Disneyland. The inn is walking distance to Disneyland - but it's a healthy 10 minute walk.  We appreciated the pools and hot tubs for an afternoon break from the crowds and heat of the theme parks.  Our third-floor room was modern and reasonably clean.  It was also very quiet; despite being right on Katella, the room's AC drowned out any possible traffic noise.  The price was terrific - about $110 from Disneyland.com. The only downside was a crowded breakfast buffet.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your business. We are glad to hear that you had a great time while staying here with us. We also have tables on the outside of the breakfast room so our guests can use them if and when the breakfast room gets crowded. We hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay for Tinker Bell Half Marathon
Summary: I stayed at Best Western Stovall's Inn during the recent Tinker Bell Half Marathon weekend. I had no idea when I booked that my hotel was going to be directly across the street from the finish line area. This made it super convenient for me as I had to finish the race (as a walker), head back to my hotel, shower and check out to head over to the Port of Los Angeles to take a Disney cruise. The noon check out worked out perfectly for me.  The hotel was incredibly accomodating of the race by opening the breakfast area at 4 a.m. on race day!  I stayed here for one night after my cruise and noticed that my pre-cruise/race room was under renovations. I thought the room was in good shape so I'm not sure what they are doing to the rooms.  There were also new toasters in the breakfast
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for your review. Congratulations on the race! I‚Äôm very pleased to hear that you had a great time while staying with us. We try to accommodate the runners by opening the breakfast room early enough for them to get something in their stomachs before they start the race. I hope your cruise was great! We hope to see you soon!

Summary: With a 24hr layover in Los Angeles I decided to take my friend to Disneyland for the day and stay out at Anaheim for the night. The ride out from LAX took half an hour at the most and this was on a Monday morning.  We arrived at 9am and our room was all ready to check in to, which was fantastic after a long trip from Australia. They also provided a complimentry breakfast each morning which had pastries, cereal, fruit and I think a few hot options.  Our room was nicely decorated and the beds were super comfy. If I had to pick something negative about the place it would be that it's a little noisy when your rolling your luggage along the cement walkways right outside people's rooms.  The location was great. Walking distance to Dsineyland. We walked through the Disney Californian
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review. We value your opinion and business. I‚Äôm very pleased to hear that you had a wonderful stay with us. That‚Äôs great that you we able to walk over to Disney and enjoy the scenery. We hope to see you guys soon!

Summary: My husband and I stayed here on our trip to Disneyland.  We chose it because we were able to book it on points.   I would recommend it because it's exactly what you expect.  It's clean, has a bed, a tv and an updated washroom.  We didn't spend much time in the hotel, and we didn't use any of the amenities.  We did view the pool and it looked clean.   The only real downside was the worst breakfast I've ever seen try to pass for breakfast.  Even the coffee was horrible.  Our room had a fridge so we were able to purchase food and keep it in our room.  If you're thinking of booking this place because it comes with breakfast, I would suggest reconsidering.   Choose this hotel because it's clean and a short walk to Disneyland (don't get tricked into taking the shuttle unless you're
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your business. We have added more items to our breakfast which includes scrambled eggs and sausage. We hope you get to come and stay with us again.

Summary Heading: very nice, short walk to Disneyland
Summary: Its very nice, priced a little higher than places directly across from Disneyland, but still not far at all. In fact you can expect locals to place coupons on your door, this is nice for ordering pizza or Chinese, if you dont have transportation.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We value your business and we hope you stay with us again. Hope to see you soon!!

Summary Heading: One of the best places to stay near Disneyland
Summary: We just returned from our vacation and are sad that it's over.  We had fun staying at this hotel and I think the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in.  I love that there are two pools and spas.  The spas were large enough to fit many people, though my wife and I often had them to ourselves.  The topiary garden is a nice touch and fun!  The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney by walking through the Grand Californian Hotel.  The breakfast is very basic, but enough.  There was cereal, french toast, fruit, and pastries.  In general it was quiet, but I could tell the walls were very thin.  We had one family check into the room next to us for one night and I could hear every word they said.  Fortunately, they did not stay up late or get up too
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time on your review. A lot of our guest‚Äôs compliment our beds. They say that it‚Äôs the best sleep that they have ever had. I glad that you were able to enjoy our spas. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: Just returned from a 4 night stay here to run the Disney Tinkerbell Half marathon.  This hotel was perfectly located to walk to Downtown Disney (short cut through Grand California Hotel to get there) and the parks.  As well, it was amazingly close to the start and finish lines for the race.  The rooms looked upgraded, very nicely appointed. My only complaint would be that the room smelled a bit stuffy when you first enter it - so we had to sleep with the window open to air it out.  But the beds/bedding/pillows were super comfy!  One night was very windy, so there was rattling going one. But we opened the bathroom windown and the front window to help with that.  Housekeeping was great - we requested more conditioner and we got it every day we were there.  The breakfast was decent
Manager Response: Thank you for your review we appreciate your business. Congratulations on running the marathon. I do apologize for the smell in the room. I will make sure that housekeeping double checks the rooms before we give them out. I hope to see you soon!

Summary: Stayed at Stovall's in January 2012. Arrived at 8.45pm just in time to see the fireworks at Disneyland from the hotel. Great start to the holiday. Spacious, clean and well appointed room. Ten minute walk to Disneyland. Very reasonably priced including satisfying breakfast. Staff very pleasant.
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for the review. I'm glad that you had a great time while staying here with us. We hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: THE BEST VALUE FOR YOUR BUCK!!!!
Summary: Ok, so, I travel for business 5 days a week and I get to see many many hotels; having said that, here are the top 3 reasons why Stovall's Inn will be MY only Disneyland hotel :  1) Location -  an easy walk to Disney and CA Adventures gates, I would say an 8 minute walk.  Also, head down Katella and turn right at Harbor and go down about 2 miles and you have tons of stores and a variety of places to eat.  POLLO NORTENO is just down Harbor and OMG, beats Pollo Loco a million times over!!! We saw Denny's, Subways, RiteAid, Pizza places, CPK, Cheescake Factory, PF Changs straight down Katella as well.  There's also an Albertsons, Target and a Ross on Harbor for those last minute things you will need.  2) GREAT STAFF - I can't think of anything to complain about.  Polite and helpful
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time on your review. We value your service. As location goes you are surrounded of a lot of shopping, eatery, pharmacies. I appreciate you complimenting our staff. I will pass the word. Regarding the pencils your are Very Welcome. It‚Äôs our pleasure to assist our guest‚Äôs. It‚Äôs great that you were able to enjoy the pools and the hot tubs. It‚Äôs always great to use them after a long day at Disneyland. We hope to see you guys again!

Summary Heading: Great Place To Stay- But Don't Drink The Coffee
Summary: Room was great.  Can't beat the location. Staff were helpful and attentive.  Breakfast was also very good- but they had some of the WORST coffee imaginable- also no half and half available.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your comments. I‚Äôm glad that you had a great stay and enjoyed our breakfast. I have passed the word to management to check on the coffee. We won‚Äôt know until our guest‚Äôs inform us of what is great and not so great. We do have powder and liquid creamer for our breakfast room. Thank you again and hope to see you soon!

Summary: Stayed at the hotel while attending a big trade show at the convention center. Room was clean, nicely remodeled with comfortable beds. It rained and there were weird noises in the middle of the night which kept me awake, sounded like it was pounding on an air conditioner unit or something. Had problems with toilet not working well. Coffee was empty in the breakfast room, so I got stuck with decaf! Other than that the continental breakfast was your usual fare of doughnuts and cereal, although they also had pancakes available. Very walkable to Downtown Disney or the convention center. Parking was an issue, they charge an extra $8 a day, but if you go to Disneyland and return after 3pm on the day of checkout, be prepared to pay an extra $24 on a credit card as you leave! They have
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Yes, we are a short 5 min. walk to the Anaheim Convention Center. I‚Äôm sorry if the regular coffee was empty and the time you were there. I will let the breakfast staff know about that. A lot of the properties here in Anaheim are starting to charge for parking or have a resort fee. Since 2010 we have charged $8.00 a day for parking. Your parking is good till 3pm the day of your departure. After 3pm the parking meter takes over. I‚Äôm sorry unfortunately all properties are all independtly owned and have their own policies. I hope you change your mind and come and visit us again when you‚Äôre in town.

Summary: This was our 6th stay at Stovall's and we enjoy many times and are planning on going back this summer! After a long day at the parks its amazing to lay down in their beds which are oh, so comfortable. We did have one problem with our rooms not being cleaned, so we needed to go to the front desk, but they got it cleaned. We did run out of tooth paste on our 4th day, when went down to the gift shop we found out that it was closed for the rest of the time we were there so we had to find somewhere else to get it since we did not rent a car, just wish that they would have a sign letting you know that sometime during your stayi t would be closed.. On the day we got there, we noticed that our message button wouldnt stop flashing, so they desk got it fixed for us! I do not exactly
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location, average service, good value for money
Summary: The morning walk to Disneyland was the best feature of the hotel. everything is quite basic. Clean but outdated rooms, small parking lot, basic front desk service. A little more attention to details would make this a better place to stay. Swimming pool was good; better amenities would make it great. Overall: good value for money, but don't expect a steal.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We had a really great stay!
Summary: This hotel was an awesome place to stay while my husband and I went to Disneyland for our honeymoon. We were on a budget and this hotel fit right in!  We actually arrived a bit early, around 10:30am, and Jason was able to check us into the room! (A very big plus in my book!) When we got to the room, it was very tastefully decorated. The king bed was PERFECT.  Breakfast was good, no meat, but they did have some hard boiled eggs available. The breakfast area can get a bit crowded, so I would suggest getting there right when it starts at 6:30am.  The FREE wifi was what you could expect from a free service. Not too bad, my husband and I were actually able to stream a few movies at night. (That's another thing that I can not understand: why people COMPLAIN about a FREE wifi service.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Get what you pay for, but great location!!
Summary: This is the second time my family and I have stayed at this hotel, and not a lot has changed between 2001 and now...  location - YOU CAN"T BEAT IT! They are situated kiddy corner to California Adventure park, and just up the street from the Disney hotels...it takes less than 20 minutes to walk to the Grand Californian hotel, cut through to Downtown Disney, and enter the parks...FANTASTIC! There is also a shuttle stop right outside the hotel, which came in handy when we didn't feel like walking back after a loooong day :) They are right next to an excellent restaurant, too!  Check-In - The desk agents were friendly and welcoming, and very accommodating. We were a group of 6 with 2 rooms, and though we did originally ask for side-by-side rooms, we were not granted this request. We
Manager Response: none

Summary: I  have been visiting disneyland several times since 1995 and used to stay in Magic Carpet/Magic Lamp Motel (now Anabella Hotel site) during their heydays . During one of my stay there in the year 1999 , I did pass by Best Western Stovall Inn which are located along the same street of Katella and thinking to myself whether I should try to stay there for my future Disney trips .My last visit was in the year 2007 and I stayed at Quality Inn and Suites at the South Manchester Ave , which were really a disappointment to my whole family . The front desk personnel were not really attentive to our needs and to make matter worse , when my left behind luggage did finally arrived from LAX airport , they were not willing to accept on my behalf and claimed no such person staying there
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good service depending on who answers the phone!
Summary: We were pleasantly surprised at how nicely the rooms had been redone since our last stay 4 years ago.  Everything seemed updated and much nicer than we'd remembered.  The first evening we noticed a few ants on the sink area.  Just 3 or 4, not a whole army.  So we cleaned them up and didn't think much of it. The next night after being in Disneyland all day, we came back to about 15-20 ants.  Again, not a huge mess, but not what we wanted to be seeing.  My husband called the desk and the night manager made a comment that he had the same issues at home sometimes.  (As if we wanted to know that?!). He did offer to send someone up to clean them up, which we had already done, and said they could spray the next day.  Well, we have 2 small children with asthma, so bug spray doesn't
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had 3 adjoining rooms overlooking the pool area ~ just as we'd asked for when we made the reservation.  3 generations of family along.  Staff is exceptional and patient.  Breakfast was perfect for us as none of us are huge breakfast eaters.  This is our second stay at Stovall's and we'll go back if the Ducks go to the Rose Bowl again!  :)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a reasonably priced hotel near Disneyland
Summary: 5 of us stayed here for 7 nights during Christmas and the hotel served us all just fine.  Rooms were spacious enough, even for 3 adults in one room.  The beds were comfortable and larger than expected it seemed for being doubles.  Shower was great, there is a fridge and microwave and self-brew coffee maker in the room, as well as a flat screen tv.  No in-room safe, but there are safes available at the front desk to use.  Complimentary breakfast is nothing to rave about, but has the cold basics like cereal, bread, danishes, donuts, hard boiled eggs, oranges, great little red delicious apples, orange/apple drinks (not juice!), milk, 24 hr coffee, tea and hot chocolate, and rotating hot items of french toast sticks, pancakes, and biscuits and gravy.  Lots of carbs and no yogurt
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed December 18, 19 and 20, 2011.  Great location and Great price.  The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and could answer all of our questions.  The front desk sold Disney packages and California Adventure. Which was handy so you don't have to stand in lines at the main gate.  We walked to the park all 3 days and didn't feel it was far.  A shuttel bus also stops directly in front of the hotel. You can use the bus all day if needed for the same price.  The hotel provided breakfast which consisted of donuts, cereals, hardboiled eggs, toast,  fresh fruit (apples oranges) and several choices in beverages.  Hot entrees varied daily  which were pancakes, french toast sticks or biscuits and gravy.  The rooms were clean and the beds fantastic.  The room had a microwave,
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed December 1-21st 2011. Could see Disney Claifornia from room. Took ten minutes to walk to Disney. Staff very helpful. Rooms clean. Beds comfortable. Have stayed in several motels around Disney over the years, this is the one we will always return to. Stay away from Edon Roc across the street, it is a hole and they decieve with their pics on the internet.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean & affordable for the budget minded
Summary: We (8 adults, 4 little ones under 3)stayed here last night after a full day at Disney and it met all our expectations. This is a best western, so that to me means cleanliness and budget friendly. I called the morning of our stay at 7am and asked that rather than paying for parking at Disney ($15) AND the $8/night fee at the hotel if we could park before check in and they let us park shortly thereafter, no prob (3 vehicles) We had a quick breakfast at Tiffy's (food=very mediocre) staff was very friendly. We walked to Dland with 2 double strollers and were at Disney within 15 min, cutting through California hotel. Stovall's breakfast was to be expected cereal,pastries toast etc. My nieces enjoyed the fruit and pancakes. The breakfast area was very crowded so plan on getting bumped
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is quite close to Disneyland, but really a shuttle is required most times. Service staff were friendly and helpful, but reception staff were less so. The continental breakfast is a plus. Rooms were clean and serviced well. It is a little far from the main drag for the restaurants, and there is no food available at the hotel, apart from breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best Value Close to Disney. Great for a Sister Getaway
Summary: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for a family wedding (and of course a Disney Vacation!!!). Although I have stayed at 'higher-class' Anaheim Hotels that have been really nice, this one was amazing considering what we paid for it ($79/night booked through expedia). Here is the breakdown:  The Room: Looks exactly like the pictures. The beds were comfy (which is super important because I have a bad back). The fridge was great for water, snacks or leftovers from the restaurants (the microwave was great for re-heating). The bathroom was adequate, shower head power was fairly weak, however such is the case at the pricier hotels as well.  The Location: Across from the back-side of California Adventure and the Paradise Pier Hotel. My sister and I felt comfortable and safe. There
Manager Response: none

Summary: So I stayed on this hotel during our last visit to DisneylandI(12/5 to 12/8), Location is just perfect, our 4 year old was able to walk to Disneyland without complaining. You get free continental breakfast, they offer Juices, cereal, Coffee, toast, pancakes and things like that, I hate when people complain about continental breakfast what are you expecting a custom omelet? is not gonna happen, I know is not the best breakfast ever but it will get you going!! Room was Clean and the   cleaning staff was friendly, not sure if speaking Spanish to the ladies helped us!!! In general is a good place to Sleep and eat some breakfast because that's all you will do there, all day you will be at Disneyland I'm assuming. So Bottom Point is GOOD Location and Good Value!!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not a lot of close restaurants, OK if you have a car, not if your walking
Summary: This hotel is located close to Disneyland, it is about a 10 min walk, but we only found 2 restaurants within a close proximity.  After walking all day in the parks and walking back to the hotel then going out for supper we were tired of walking.  Limited selection as most restaurants are on Harbor, our second visit to area and we found this not as convenient as other location on Harbor.  Hotel itself is dated but well maintained and clean.  Beds were OK but the coffee is terrible.  Would stay at hotel again if it was for 1 or 2 nights and I had a vehicle.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good location at an excellent price!
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights in early November. Rooms were quite small but were fairly clean. Really can't complain for the $70 a night we paid. Breakfast wasnt great but was free. No in-room safe which was a bit of a concern but we had no problems. Great location for those going to Disneyland, with it only being about a 10 min walk and the staff were quite helpful. The free wireless was quite slow and dropped in and out all the time! However, overall was quite happy with our stay and would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good alternative to the Harbor Blvd. hotels when visiting Disneyland
Summary: I took a solo trip to pick up my daughter at college in Irvine, and decided to stay near Disneyland, since we were planning to spend some time there before heading home to Northern CA.  This was one of the few area hotels we hadn't tried yet, and I thought it would be a good opportunity to give it a whirl.  Especially with prices like $78/night!    I've decided I like staying on this end of the parks more than across the street on Harbor, because a walk through the Grand Californian and Downtown Disney is much more pleasant and magical than a trek through the Harbor mess.  It's a bit farther to walk, but I'll take the distance for the nice atmosphere.  This hotel has recently been upgraded and the rooms are stylish, comfortable and well-equipped.  My room had a stale-smoke smell
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A convenient location for Disneyland visitors
Summary: Although I rated most of the hotel's aspects as average, I gave it a Very Good overall rating.  Why?  Because I've stayed in other hotels in this area that were worse, and being an average hotel in a high demand location like this makes it relatively above average.  We (two adults, two kids under 9) stayed here for 4 nights.  Our primary reason for selecting a hotel in this area was for the close proximity to Disneyland.    Location: This was our first time staying on the south side of Disneyland.  On previous trips we stayed on the east side, very close to the front entrance.  After trying both, we prefer the south side because it cuts down on the number of times we have to pass through the security booths.  You see, most days, after leaving Disneyland, we do some shopping or
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here in November, 2011.  Here is a quick recap of our stay: Positives: -Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. -The location is pretty good - you can see California Adventure from the parking lot - but in reality, it is quite a walk through the Grand Californian to get to the park (and keep in mind there are entrances from the Grand Californian where they require you to show a room key from their resort so go through Downtown Disney).  The Grand Californian is nice and we stopped and hung out by their fireplace in the lobby for a bit. - Breakfast is included.  Negatives: -The breakfast was disgusting.  The room they serve it in is too small and it was packed with people - gross.  The food was also gross.  They had loaves of white and wheat bread, icky donuts and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time on your review. We appreciate your comments and business. I do apologize for any noises caused by housekeeping. We will bring it to their attention to be more quiet and careful when loading and unloading in front of rooms. We do hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Judge the hotel on what your prioity/needs are.
Summary: My wife and I just recently stayed at this hotel Nov 2011.  We have stayed in hotels from 'Dives' to luxury! We read many Tripadvisor reviews of this hotel.  As I previously read about the bathroom doors not properly shutting, the air conditioner was loud and the hotel room door can easily be 'a jarred open'.. ya, saw that too, but you need to ask yourself... what is your priority/needs for a hotel?  This hotel is GREAT, pending on what your priorities/needs  are... either hotel accommodations or your time spent at Disneyland.    If you are needing a hotel that is low priced, this is your hotel.  If you are looking for something close (not on Disney grounds) by and with in walking distance, this is your hotel.  If you are going to spend more time at Disneyland and just need a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate taking the time on letting us know what you thought about our property. We hope to see you again!

Summary: After a lot of searching I booked this hotel for the great rate I found online however, the location was so good that I  probably would have paid more.  My son and I flew in and did not rent a car and being able to walk right across the street to the walkway to Disneyland was wonderful.  After a quick shortcut through the Grand Californian Hotel we were right there in Downtown Disney with a short stroll to the entrance.  The pool area is also very nice and the free breakfast included things like biscuits and gravy, hard boiled eggs, fresh fruit...Our room was clean and spacious including a refrigerator for no extra charge and appeared to have been renovated recently.  I found the best rate via the Best Western website after comparing many sites.
Manager Response: I‚Äôm glad you had a great time here at the Stovall‚Äôs inn. We appreciate your comments and your business. It‚Äôs great that you were able to use the pool and enjoy it after a long day at Disney. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: Best western stovalls inn was fantastic value for the price. Yes it does say its across the road from disneyland which is technically true however the entrance is a good 15 minute walk away. i didnt mind though, good exercise for all the junk food i ate. rooms were very nice, the beds were so soft and comfortable. breakfast was basic but thats all i really wanted when going to the theme parks. highly recommended. tiffys restaurant just across the road was great too. we were going to try cocos next door but they automatically add gratuities which didnt sit well with me. what if we got a nasty server ? will definately stay here again on my next trip
Manager Response: Greatly appreciate the review and we value your business. I‚Äôm pleased to hear that you had a great time here. We hope to see you soon

Summary Heading: Good location, outdated tv, small rooms, bad internet & bad service
Summary: Location was close to disney downtown. Not able to connect to wi-fi, front desk unable to help & sent me to call tech support. Tech was also unable to solve issue, was never able to connect. Rooms are small and tv is outdated.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us knows on your stay here. I do apologize for any inconvenience that this may have caused you. I will make sure to call the company to find out what happened. We hope you give us another opportunity to serve you. Take care and see you soon!

Summary: My sister and I make it a point to get together once a year and visit Disneyland.  Our last 2 stays have been at this property, which is a very short walk to Downtown Disney, almost as convenient as the actual Disney hotels but about 1/3 of the price. (Tip: Always shop around for best price, and don't forget to check the property's web site for special Internet prices.) The rooms are very nice and clean for the price.  They are exactly as pictured, so there are no surprises upon arrival.  The beds are extremely comfortable. The property itself is a few decades old, but they seem to do a good job of keeping it maintained.  The pool area is large and kept extremely clean with 2 pools, 2 hot tubs, and 1 kiddie pool.  Also, near the pool is a very cute topiary garden. The
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time on your review. We appreciate your business and your comments. Thank you once again and we hope to see you guys again!

Summary Heading: Met our needs but expected more base on the cost
Summary: Overall it was average, we always try to stay at best western due to the good value, but we thought that the best value did not apply at this Best Western, we have had much better stays at much cheaper Best Westerns, at the rate of $199. per night plus a extra parking fee of $8.00 we thought it was overpriced.   Over all there was nothing really wrong with the unit but it was tight, the beds were hard, the towels and were not plentiful, no wash clothes for the face and no large towels, and the fridge was all but un-useable due to the tight area it was located at. The free breakfast was more basic that others we have enjoyed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My Husband and I and our 11 Year Old Son stayed at the Best Western Plus Stovalls Inn for 14 nights from October 23 , 2011 !   Our Hotel room was nice and clean and was roomy for the 3 of us, the bathroom was a good size and the shower head was a massaging head . It was good having the vanity basin in the main room instead of in the bathroom as it was quicker to get ready each day .   The Breakfast was good, but some of it  was so unhealthy as they had chocolate doughnuts and doughnuts with icing sugar on them as well as pastries, I did`nt eat them as they were so gross and tasted like preservatives - and I am not a fussy eater ! They also had 3 types of cereals and milk, orange juice, coffee, Tea , Hot chocolate, Toast, Fresh Apples, Oranges and they would have on alternate
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good hotel at walking distance from Disney
Summary: We stayed at several hotels in the Disney area, but this was the cheapest but certainly good hotel in walking distance. You just cross the street and Disney's back parking lot to find yourself in the midst of downtown Disney after a five minutes walk. You can leave your car in front of the hotel which had more than plenty available free parking spaces. We had a nice room on the top floor which makes sure that you are not bothered by walking noises from people above you. The room was large enough and clean. Air conditioner was a bit noisy but it was cool enought outside to leave it off. Staff at the reception were friendly and efficient. A Denny's and small market are right next door. Definitely a place to consider.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I usually love this hotel and go there every year for my Disneyland vacation.  They give me the same room every year and the customer service is usually excellent.  This year the frustration started when trying to book in with Bookit.  Bookit had the hotel closed until December in their system.  It took me two months to have it figured out between the hotel and Bookit.    The hotel was filled up on the 22nd of October, the first night of my 15 day stay.  I had to book at another hotel for my trip.  I had my heart again set on the Stovalls so I called numerous times to see if they had any cancellations and they did.  I called bookit and cancelled my hotel portion of my trip and paid the extra to have them book me into the Stovalls.  The hotel portion became non refundable at this
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel in excellent location for Disneyland
Summary: Stayed at Stovall's Inn for 9 nights from 24 October with my daughter who uses a wheelchair.  We found the rooms very spacious and well appointed. The bathroom was also spacious and the showers excellent.  The reception staff, breakfast room staff and maids were all very friendly and helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed the breakfasts, there was plenty of choice including delicious pastries!!! We booked Super Shuttle for our transfers from LAX and found their service was also excellent.  They dropped us off and picked us up at the door plus they are cheaper than the Disneyland Express, which as the previous reviewer guynwdm discovered, drops you off a little way off.    The hotel is a short 15 minute walk from the park entrances.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again, in my
Manager Response: none

Summary: While the hotel is close to the parks, I will never stay here again.  Air conditioning was poor and noisy.  Internet extremely slow.  The shuttle from the airport (Orange County) did not stop at hotel and you have to get dropped off about half a block away to get there.  The breakfast was supposed to have some hot options but mostly it was soggy (over microwaved) french toast sticks or luke warm gravy (where the sausage was in the gravy, I have no idea).  There was supposed to be no fee for parking but we were charged that as well.  The worst part of the stay there was that the maid left the room open after cleaning it.  Nothing was stolen and if I had not returned mid day to find this, who knows how long it would have been left open.  After the front desk blaming me for leaving
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your experience her with us. The Super Shuttle and Disney Express do drop you off at our property. I‚Äôm not sure what shuttle was taken. We are adding more items to our breakfast on the beginning of the year. I do apologize if the door was left open. We have spoken to the staff to make sure they double check the doors. We hope you give us another opportunity to serve you. Thank you and we hope to see you again.

Summary: We decided at the last minute to take a weekend trip to Disneyland.  With only a couple of hours to plan and find a place to stay, I turned to Tripadvisor for reviews when the hotel I usually stay at came up as not avaiable.  After reading about the free breakfast and recently remodeled rooms I looked into the price and found it to be one of the lowest.  While this made me nervous, I didn't have time to be picky!  We arrived at Stovall's at 1:30 in the morning and didn't have a reservation until the next day.  (We thought we'd stop someplace else along the way.)  The hotel clerk was so helpful and not only was able to check us into our room for an extra night, he was able to give us a cheaper rate for all three nights than I had booked online!  He asked which floor we would like
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for your review. I‚Äôm very pleased that you had a great time here. Maybe next time you can enjoy our pools and sit in our hot tub. I‚Äôm pleased to hear that we were able to accommodate you on a very early arrival and a great rate. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: We stayed a week in October hoping the weather would be milder and the parks less crowded.  Unfortunately for us, it was both hot and crowded pretty much every day.  Overall we had a decent stay at this hotel.   We had just a few minor issues.  1.  I had called ahead about a possible early check-in which seemed to not be any trouble, but upon arrival it was not available and we ended up having to burn a few hours - challenging after travelling all morning.  2.  Took us a couple days to coordinate with housekeeping about a cleaning schedule that fit ours, but wasn't a big problem.  3.  We decided to hit the pool/hot tub our final morning and when we went there a gentleman was cleaning (and smoking) and told us it wasn't open yet.  We pointed out that the sign said 9am and it was

Summary: We booked this hotel for a 3 night stay in Septemeber, purely to visit the Mouse! This isn't a high end hotel but is perfectly good for a base while visiting Disneyland.  Good points first: the room was large, the shower good and powerful, there was a good size fridge, the walk to the theme parks/downtown Disney was approx 10 mins (as long as you cut through the Grand California). The walk is peaceful in the morning (most people seem to stay the other end by HoJo) and beautiful at night because all the trees are lit with fairy lights. The area felt safe to walk at night, though there were a couple of homeless people asking for change. Downsides: The room was terribly dark and we needed the lights on even during daylight hours. The beds were very very squishy and we kept rolling
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and i stayed at this hotel in mid October. The rooms have been nicely updated. the rooms still have the same noisy a/c units though. the only problem i had with the room was the front door. it needed quite a bit of force to open it. something was rubbing on something
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for our Disneyland vacation. We checked a lot of hotels and inns in the area and this one looked good for our needs. The service at the main desk is not fast as they are lacking the personnel at busy hours. Parking priviledges are $8 per day. There are a few buildings, two stories high, with concrete floors therefore not too much noise. The access to the upper floors is by staircases or elevator. The rooms are nice, good size, have a mini fridge and microwave oven, a full size dresser, a small table, a working desk, cable TV and free internet. The bathroom has a window towards the outside but it is pretty humid in CA to stay open long or to eliminate the moisture after the shower. The inn offers free breakfast, not their forte. The variety is slim and there is not
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here in June for our 3 day adventure at Disneyland/CA Adventures. Beautifully decorated, but small room (do note that the beds are very high as my toddler fell off once - thankfully he was ok), decent breakfast (get there early and have your partner in crime save a table as space is limited, french toast "sticks" were awful, but free), and the pool was fabulous (two hot tubs - one is hotter than the other - and two pools). On the down side, there is a pretty good walk to the parks. I was okay with the walk since I wasn't going to shell out $$$ on the park hotels that are close by, so I dealt with it. I didn't use a rental car, but I did notice that the lots were packed with cars. Overall, a great hotel with decent package for families with small children.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here at the beginning of October. Our room was in the 200 block and was newly renovated. The air conditioner looked brand new. The carpet, furnishings, all looked new. The doors looked old but that's not a big deal to us. Unlike the other reviews here, we never saw them run out of food at breakfast and that includes our last day where we were among the people still there after 9 AM.   The pool was nice and very clean. The walk to disneyland took us roughly 12 minutes so it was OK. There's forum posts here that give details of how to cut thru the Grand Californian hotel lobby to get to Downtown Disney.   The 3rd floor balcony gave us an OK view of the fireworks at night.    Hotel staff was very nice. They don't have in room safes but they did have lock-boxes for free

Summary: Honestly for what you pay, I think it is an awesome hotel! We were in room 305 (top floor) and it is one of the rooms with an adjoining room- although we just stayed in one room. It was clean with comfy beds. You can see the fireworks from the balcony which was cool (you could hear the fireworks at 9:30 every night- not so cool if you want to head to bed early!)  The breakfast was pretty lame, just a whole lot of carbs so we didn't eat there! We ate at Coco's or Denny's which was more our style for a big breakfast!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We and another couple of friends stayed here Oct 1st to 9th on a trip to LA and Disneyland. This was our first stay at Stovall's Inn and Anaheim. The location of the hotel was great, a 10min walk to Disney. The room has been recently renovated and the beds were very comfortable.  The room has a microwave and a fridge. The air con is very noisy even though our unit looked new it was of a very old design, Luckily it wasn't so warm that we needed it on all night. The walls are thin and there is some noise from neighbours but that is part of staying at a hotel close to Disney in that most rooms will be full of excited kids not used to being quiet.There is a large gap under the doors for some reason. Summary: My sister and I stayed here on a recent trip to Disneyland. We have visited the Anaheim area multiple times although this was our first stay at Stovall's Inn. The location of the hotel was great, a 10min walk to Disney and part of that is through the Grand Californian and Downtown Disney which made the walk very enjoyable. The inside of the room has been nicely renovated and the beds were very comfortable.   Our room was located right across from the lobby and the noise from the road was significant. After the first night we turned on the air conditioner just to drown out the noise from the road and the people on either side of us since the walls were very thin you could hear everything. There was such a large gap between the door and the floor that each night we stuffed a towel

Summary: I stayed at the Best Western with my daughters 10 & 12 yrs old. No complaints. Very clean,well managed. Rooms are equipped with coffee maker, mini fridge and free Wifi. The free continental breakfast was more than basic and offered a wide range of food both hot & cold. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful.There are 2 pools and 2 hot tubs. Kids loved this.It was was nice to relax in the hot tub after a long days walk through Disney.Coco's restaurant is located right beside the hotel. Quality food at a reasonable price (Great kids menu). It was only a few blocks walking distance to Downtown Disney.This was my 6th trip to this area,i have stayed in a different hotel each time. Best Western is my favorite thus far. Happy travels!

Summary: The location of this hotel was a bit of surprise to us as we anticipated that it was just in front of the main gates of Disneyland.  Upon arrival we realized we were actually on the other side almost like the back door to Disneyland.  The walk wasn't too bad only about 15 minutes but it was through the California Adventure hotel then onto the Downtown Disney boardwalk.  After 11am they currently were allowing guests to go directly into California Adventure which was handy if you had the Park Hopper. Summary Heading: Affordable and a short walk from the Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: I was looking for an affordable but decent place to stay within walking distance from the Anaheim Convention Center. As with other Best Western hotels, this one is not a luxury holiday destination, but provides the basics one would expect. A big bonus was the free Internet, as I understand that most other hotels in the area charge for Internet access.

Summary: We stayed at the Stovall,s in Oct.We booked with airmiles so the price was right.Check in was fast and front desk staff were very pleasant.We had a room on the third floor looking out towards the pool.The nights they had the fireworks at Disney land we could see them from our room if you stood out on the walkway which was very nice.It was a short walk to Disneyland if you cut threw Cali.Grands lobby .The breakfast was not very good.If you were hungry it would fill the gape but dont have high hopes.The eggs tasted as they were preboiled and kept in a jar.It just was nasty.The pools were very nice and kept clean.We had a interesting happening.A group of three young people came into the pool with a cooler of beer and were swimming and having fun.Then the hotel security came in and

Summary: Book well in advance to get the best prices.  Front desk said to call and they will usually match your best price that you can find online and then you can get credit on club card.  See remarks below.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel location is okay with just a 15 minute walk to Disneyland we were lucky to have Art transportation to and from Disneyland with the bus stop right in front of the hotel. Check in and out was easy. The decor of the room and placement was nice. We had an ant problem in our room we had to be very careful no food was left on the counter top. Also our room was located next to the public laundromat and the noise from the washing and drying machine could be heard through the wall, other customers would hang out right in front of our room and smoke their cigarettes. Would I stay here again yes but I should and will request a room away from the laundromat and not complain about it after.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for an affordable price
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a few days while I was attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center. The hotel was clean and nice. The placement style of rooms is more open along the length of the building. There are elevators also. Parking was ample but there is a surcharge for the parking. Breakfast is included although the variety may not be too great. But its sufficient for fuel through the morning. The room and bathroom were clean and the beds were particularly comfy. Hot water was not an issue at all. THe room had airconditioning, a microwave and a mini-fridge. All very valuable for families with kids. TV channel selection was adequate. I did not spend too much time on the tube. Two tables in the room. One more for office work and the other for maybe tea or coffee.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just returned from staying at the Stovall's beginning 9/18/2011 through the 30th. What a great stay. Everything was clean and very nicely done. The motel has had a recent remodel and the rooms are very nice. The only complaint that we had was the housekeeping never replaced our coffee or left any in the room, we had to go to Target to buy coffee, also if you went to breakfast and left your items in the room, you can not get back in if housekeeping was there to clean the room. We missed the 1st bus to disney one day due to this. But, it was a nice stay and we will be back next year.

Summary: Great location. SUPER STAFF. good breakfast. easy transportation. acceptable rooms,fridge microwave. I didn't like the PAID parking,I think this should be free.

Summary Heading: No Frills but clean, comfy and close to Disneyland
Summary: First, please be aware this is a BUDGET MOTEL. But with that in mind, I don't think you will find a cleaner motel in the Disneyland area for this price range. The rooms are a little small but updated nicely. Everyone at the front desk was very kind and helpful, even calling the local store for us to see if an item was in stock. We had a great view of Disney California and the fireworks. Our room was located near the pool so I worried about noise, but really didn't hear much. Our teenagers loved that the pools were open until 11 pm and really loved the nearby restaurant for pizza delivery. The beds are a little small but very comfortable. The only thing I would recommend is to be sure to get a room that has an updated air conditioner.  One of our rooms did not have this and was a
Manager Response: We appreciate your business and your comments. We are glad that you had a great time here at the Stovall's Inn. It is a beautiful walk to the park. We hope to see you guys again!

Summary: I have just returned from my trip to Anaheim. Stovalls Inn is a very good place to stay, centrally located to theme parks, restaurants, supermarket etc. The grandsons loved the pools and I loved the hot tubs. The room was pleasant and the front desk personnel extremely helpful. Thankyou, we will return to Stovalls on our next trip to that area.
Manager Response: I hope you had a great time while you were here with us. I'm glad that you were able to enjoy our great pools and hot tub. We appreciate your business and we hope to see you again!

Summary: I stayed here in September with my partner for 8 nights and liked it.  The room was nice & clean.  The decor was modern & the bed was really comfy. The location is brilliant and the walk to Disney only took 10 minutes going through the Grand Californian hotel.  The restaurant Co Co's next door was nice too. The only thing I didn't like was that it was quite noisy at night from the road, but this wasn't too bad to stop me staying here again. We had the breakfast that was included but this is just basic but adequate.
