Summary: The exterior is not fancy but the rooms are quite comfortable for the price.  Cozy beds, modern decor and a very close walk to Disneyland. I traveled with my husband, 6 year and 2 year old daughters and found the pool area great for us. There is a wading pool for my little one, 2 larger pools, and 2 hot tubs.  The pool area landscaping is fun - animal shaped schrubery.  Its not fancy but completely served our needs.  The location beats taking shuttles in and out of the park area with little ones. There is also a Cocos (breakfast place)  very close by so if you arent pleased with continental breakfast you can order food there.

Summary: My spouse and I stayed here at the end of August for 2 nights.  Check in was quick and easy, with no line up.  The front desk staff were courteous and friendly.  Our room was located on the 3rd floor near the back of the hotel, which was a bit of a walk, but not a big deal for just the two of us.  As many reviews have said... the hotel has recently been updated.  Rooms have new mattresses, and clean sheets.  The bathroom was quite nice for this kind of hotel... very nice marble floors, and a good sized tub/shower.  There was also a small window that let in some natural light into the bathroom, which was great.  The sink and mirror were separate from the actual bathroom.  Only one sink in our room, but for just the two of us, it was ok.  The small fridge and microwave were great

Summary: My family stayed at 3 Best Westerns this summer. The first was so successful we opted for 2 more on our travels.  We started at Best Western Stovalls choosing it for it's proximity to Disneyland, which was an easy walk through the Grand Californian lobby to Disney land. Thank you to trip advisor for this hint. The front reception staff at each location was excellent and helpful, providing information and directions easily. We extend out stay at BW-Stovalls by one day and obtained the same discount rate; thank you! We were provided electrical hook up for our trailer and were charged for only one vehicle for our 5 day stay. Manager Response: Thank you for your business and comments. We love to hear the good and what we need to improve on. I‚Äôm very excited to hear that you had a great time here with us. We will be adding more items to our breakfast on the beginning of the year. We hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Good hotel, but if you forget something in your room you never see it again
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and ofcourse only to visit Disneyland! This is a good choice. The rooms are big and clean. There is a t.v with many channels. Free wi-fi (didnt work very good). The staff was helpfull and friendly. There is a pool, its close to the road and no  fence or something. It has a stop infront of the hotel to disney and comes every 20 min (more or less). We spotted a cockroach or waterbug in our bathroom and asked for another room and got it right away. The breakfast was not so good. Very crowed, long waiting time, broken toasters, only fat food (americans love fat food), cereals or toast (with a broken toaster...). Summary Heading: Price was decent and room was modern, but very noisy.  Breakfast was gross.
Summary: My husband, daughter, and I stayed here last weekend for a Disneyland trip.  I got the room for $97 a night for summer rates which is a good deal.  And it was right across the street so we could walk there and not have to worry about parking our car there and being charged an arm and a leg.  The motel did charge $8.00 a night to park, but they told us that on the website when we booked so we knew about it before.  What is nice about that is that you need a card to get in and out so I felt my car was safe.   The hotel room was nice....very modern and recently redone.  We were not in our room much anyhow.  The first night we got up early so the noise did not bother us, however after a long day at Disneyland, the next morning we wanted to sleep in a bit.  At about 6:00 we could

Summary Heading: VERY NICE HOTEL AND CLOSE TO DISNEYLAND
Summary: One of the best  hotels I've stayed in, close to Disneyland and restaurants. I love the two big pools and 2 huge spas and one little mini for little baby's. my stay here at this hotel was very enjoyable, my parents were happy I chose this hotel and my little brothers were amazed. the room was really neat, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was very good and clean and spacious but they didn't have any SCRAMBLE EGGS!!! either then that it was perfect, excellent hotel staff and maid's on time with any request of towels. If you plan to stay here choose room 436 it is all the way at the end right in front of the pool and parking in front of the room is mostly always available and very quiet room. FYI: internet was not that fast in my room but did connect just took time to search.

Summary Heading: Look beneath the surface and its pretty good.
Summary: We checked into this motel with some apprehension since the reviews have been somewhat mixed, but it's proximity to Disneyland was a factor.  This is a rather large motel and it takes an army of staff to clean, man and provide the free continental breakfast to the masses that stay here every night.  In my opinion, Stovall's Inn does a good job of it.    When we first checked in to our ground floor room there was stale sweet odor of cleaning solution and thought the worst. This was a dark smallish motel room with cheap furnishings.  Very average and typical of motels of the last thirty years.  But after turning on the room air conditioner the odor immediately disappeared and our perception of the room continued to improve after that.  We knew the property was recently remodeled

Summary: I had the pleasure to stay at Best Western Stovall's Inn over the course of several months. The location is excellent - easy walk to Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center, and short drives to great restaurants and Angels Stadium. The accommodations are very comfortable and affordable. The staff are professional, courteous, friendly and always helpful to make your stay as relaxing as possible.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect location for a Disney vacation
Summary: Perfect hotel. We had planned to check in monday, we arrived Sunday close to midnight.  We were pleased that the hotel was able to accommodate us early. We had to re-check-in the next day for our reservation, which was quick and simple.  The room was cozy and quiet, even for the first floor. The room was clean but could use a steam clean on the carpet. The breakfast was good, but the coffee was weak.  The stop for the ART bus was right outside the lobby and easy to use. Overall a good place to rest and recover from a long day of Disney.

Summary: This hotel is located within walking distance from Disneyland. There is a free breakfast, but it is very light, and not a reason to stay. The proximity is the best asset. Rooms were clean, as were the grounds. Pleasant staff as well. If military, inquire at the ITT office for discount.

Summary Heading: Clean and affordable, a good combination
Summary: This hotel is nothing fancy. Old (small window unit style AC) but renovated (modern,contemporary decor;tile in the bath). The room was extremely small but our intention was to spend our time at Disneyland. The walk to Disney is probably just under a mile, so be prepared. The pool was a nice size and looked relaxing (we did not swim). The continental breakfast (mostly junkfood) was enough to get the day started on. There is asmall fridge and microwave. The bed was comfortable enough for a decent nights rest. If you want to visit Disneyland and not break the bank for a clean (and not having bedbugs is HIGH on my list for cleanliness!!), inexpensive hotel that is a no frills place to rest between the Magic of Disney, this is a good choice.

Summary: My family and I stayed here on a trip to Disneyland.  We chose this hotel because of the price and also because of how close it is to the parks and also walking distance to a few restaurants.  This hotel was just average on all accounts. Some negatives about the hotel is that it was noisy and the breakfast they offer is meager at best.  The rooms have been remodeled recently but they are very dark.  If you want something with more frills don't stay here.  We ended up moving across the street to the Paradise Pier hotel which is more expensive but worth the price as far as we were concerned.

Summary Heading: The place only gets better with each stay.

Pancakes,  waffles,  eggs,  sausage gravy and biscuits,  fresh fruit,  juices,  toast,  pastries,  coffee and tea etc.  The hit food was alternated daily to avoid boredom. Summary Heading: Very Good hotel, but you can have surprises...

They have microwave and refrigerator inside the room, very good amenities. I'd recommend this hotel.

Summary: This was a great palce to stay when visiting Disneyland. This is not what you would expect from a "Motel". Rooms were clean, updated and very nice. Microwave and refrig. in room were a plus. Summary: We were expecting a much more simple room than what we ended up with - we had a massive King sized bed which was really comfortable, and a nice bathroom with good shower pressure.  The bathroom sink was in the bedroom and had a fridge so doubled as a kitchen which was a bit weird - but we had a microwave and a fridge which was helpful!  The air con unit in the room was pretty noisy and not too great at cooling the room - we were there in June and it was relatively warm but not really hot - so it would probably be worse in the middle of summer.    The room was quiet at night, but there wasn't a lot of soundproofing so we could hear people running along the balcony outside and in the room next door - but if you are just staying there to go to disneyland then you will be up early
Manager Response: none

Summary: Started off my stay at Stovall's arriving late, thanks to Delta, not at all the fault of Stovall's.  I knew they charged for parking but was unprepared for what awaited me, arriving at 3:30 AM Atlanta time after having spent a full day at work and arising at 5:30 AM, Atlanta time.  Found out that Stovall's oversells their parking spaces when I drove through the gates and found a number of cars pacing through the lot trying to find an empty spot.  Finally parked illegally and went in and advised the desk clerk, who was not at all concerned.  Got into the room and slept a couple of hours before arising for my meeting at 7:30 AM on Saturday.  Found no water in the tub/shower and reported the problem to the front desk.  Returned at the end of the day to find the problem hadn't been
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review and I appreciate the feedback. As for the claim of overselling the parking lot, we do not actively oversell our parking lot. Due to our location and our proximity to Disneyland and the convention center, we may experience limited parking availability during our peak summer months as some guests may bring multiple cars during their stay.  For this inconvenience, my front desk manager offered Reward Points or a return visit at a discounted rate which was declined by the guest. This good faith gesture was not an attempt to buy the guest off but rather compensate the guest for the inconvenience he encountered during his stay. As for possible resolutions to dissuade future guests from bringing multiple cars, ownership has decided against penalizing guests with multiple cars. Rather than charge higher fees for multiple cars, the decision to charge a flat fee for all vehicles has been implemented since March of 2010.  Regarding the second issue involving the shower faucet, a front desk supervisor personally assisted the guest and demonstrated how to access the water in the shower. Please know I will research the issue involving the shower faucet and inquire about the feasibility of having signs made for future guests explaining how to use the faucets in the bathroom.  In closing, the guest was contacted on two separate occasions via email. I personally responded to the guest as well as our front desk manager. We take great pride in our customer service and strive to exceed our guest's expectations.

Summary: We stayed at bestwestern Stovall in Anahiem for 5days and have no complaints whats so ever the room was excellent and very modern and clean the breakfast was great!!! more than what i had expected than coffee and muffins! i have only one complaint that there was no in room safe, but that wasnt a big concern. the staff was polite and helpfull. and parking for our car was secure and gated ! nice! i would go back again to this hotel and it is priced at cheap rates too!!! wow!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Walk to Disneyland.  Good restaurants close by and can see fireworks at Disneyland too.  Nicely decorated with granite and carpet.  Thick lush bath towels.  Elevators, nice pool, nicely equipped exercise room.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Decent rooms, good location & value for money
Summary: My family and I stayed here for 6 nights.  We chose this hotel because it was affordable, within walking distance from Disneyland Resort (about a 15-min walk with kids), offered free breakfast and had good reviews here in TripAdvisor.  If you're looking for good value for money and are prepared to do the 15-min walk to and from Disneyland (bit tough on the way home when everyone, especially the kids, are tired from walking all day - a stroller is a good idea for young kids), this hotel is a good choice.  The rooms are spacious enough for a family of 4.  The free (albeit limited and repetitive selection) breakfast, and having a refrigerator and a microwave in the room helps to save on food expenses.  In-room free wifi and cable TV are a big plus too.  The Anaheim Resort Transit
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked this hotel after reading really great reviews about its proximity to Disneyland and its cleanliness. We were looking for some place clean (extremely important!) within walking distance to the parks, for a reasonable price. We were able to book a web rate through the hotel's website, the lowest they had was a 21 day-advance booking (non-refundable) for $92 USD. Parking is an extra $8/day. First off, the good. If you're looking for an extremely clean hotel just steps away from Disneyland, this is the place for you. I've never stayed in a room so clean. I couldn't believe my eyes. A definite plus. This hotel is literally across the street from Disneyland Drive, about a 10 minute leisurely walk from Downtown Disney and the parks.  Another plus (and money-saver!) is the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very hard to beat the location!
Summary: We stayed here for three nights while we did the Disneyland parks.  You won't get a hotel closer to the parks unless you stay at one of the Disney resorts.  Our room was updated, comfortable and had a fridge. The only problem was that it had two double beds instead of a queen bed. The hotel was fully booked so they couldn't change our rooms.  We spent so little time in the room though as most of our time was at the parks.  Free breakfast was ok, free wi-fi was very handy. The carpark tended to get very full at times. Staff were very courteous.  We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed 4 days there.  First 3 days we had good service. But there were several issues i would address.  We got charged for parking for 4 days for $8 dollars a night.  I was told there would be no problem parking but on several occasions i couldn't find a parking spot.   This parking fee should guarantee no problems.  I was disappointed with this part of their service...  They should not charge a parking fee for this hotel, it should be a free when a person stays there.  I also had a non smoking room but the last night came back from disneyland it smelled like someone smoked pot in my room.  i went to the front desk to talk to manager.  this was thursday night, told one not available to monday.  i had asked who went into my room but was told they couldn't tell me. I took an
Manager Response: none

Summary: There really isn't anything wrong with this place. It has the usual challenges such as lack of parking even if you pay.the gift shop for forgotten items can be annoying since you have to spend 10 bucks to use your credit card....that was an expensive floss purchase. Other than that no problems. Check in and sleep. Maids are not intrusive and do a great job. Never noticed noise or neighbors since we always stayed late at the park.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing Staff, Amazing Service..Totally Exceeds Our Expectation
Summary: My parents and sister stayed at this hotel last April. They said that all of the staff were really accommodating. Well, this is not the only thing we have to say about it. Because, when my sister left her plushie ( a black baby rottweiler) we had to call the hotel from the Philippines. What surprised us the most is that the staff were able to find the toy and the hotel was willing to ship it to us. This is truly a memorable experience because it shows how much Best Western values their guests. It may have been a small thing to others but to us, all we can say is GOOD JOB and A BIG HEARTFELT THANK YOU. We definitely recommend Best Western Anaheim and we hope of visiting back soon.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, relaxing and WALKING distance to Disneyland
Summary: Me and my family and MIL stayed here the first week of June and we had an excellent time. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and beautifully decorated. We have 3 kids (5, 2.5, 8mo) and I need to have a clean room since all of them are all over the floor, in the tub etc... this was clean and to my standards!!! I did the usual wipe down with Clorox wipes that I do at every hotel we stay at and the wipe was clean, no grim or dirt! The maid staff was very sweet and was very respectful of our belongings! The beds where more full size beds than actual Queens (don't think the rooms would support 2 Queens), my MIL and 2 of our kids had to sleep sideways, which worked for us.  The breakfast, was pretty decent as far as free breakfast goes: Biscuits and gravy,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, great location, clean and super comfy beds.
Summary: Wow what a friendly welcome from the staff, made sure we had a quiet room and directed us to a restaurant selling healthy food.   The room is lovely, 2 big super comfy beds and spotless. Easy parking great directions to Disney, really impressed and a great price.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, close to Disneyland
Summary: Check in was a breeze, all questions were answered, and the front desk staff were helpful. We traveled with 10 people, 5 adults and 5 children, got rooms close together on the second floor by the guest laundry room and our rooms were quiet, no noise heard from other people, only thing making noise was the air conditioner but got use to it. I have no flaws to report on this place, the pool and housekeeping were great. The walk to Disneyland was about 10 minutes and you could also see the fireworks from our windows which was a plus. The only downer was seeing Orkin one morning on the third floor which worried me. Thankfully all of our rooms had no pests to report.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for five days on the bottom floor.  The room is small but clean.  It took a little bit to get used to the noise from the individual air conditioner in the room.  We all enjoyed the morning breakfast.  The servers were friendly and there was a nice variety.  For free, it's great.  The only problem we encountered was that we were on the ground floor and there was a group of school children above us that would run and jump late in the evening and woke up early in the morning doing the same thing.  My own kids slept heavily, but I couldn't. The maid service was good and price for what we got was very reasonable.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Recommend staying here - we will stay again
Summary: We were on our honeymoon from NZ, and on arrival after 27 hours travelling, we were immedidately given our room, despite it not being the official "check-in" time.  It was very comfortable, very clean, and we found the staff very helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the most elaborately updated motel I can recall staying in.  They fit the outdoor walls with stone siding.  The rooms have nice linen, granite counters, refrigerators and microwaves.  But it is a motel, with exterior hallways so that its hard to leave a window open or enjoy any view.    That said, the service is great.  It's very clean.  The beds are comfortable and the wi-fi worked fine for me (Darn the luck, I was here on business).    You can walk to the Disney entrances by going north on West Street which is the north-south street beside the hotel.  Go through the entrance of the Grand Californian Hotel and follow the signs inside to Downtown Disney.  Once outside, go right to the security checks at the park entrances.  You can also get directly to Disney California
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for a 2-night getaway to Disneyland.  We're season passholders from San Diego but decided to stay a night at a local hotel. We came in the morning and they let us check in & park there early so that we could head to the park already. The room was clean, and big enough for my family of 3 (child: 1 year old).  The included continental breakfast in the morning was great.  Instead of the usual orange juice and bagels, there was also eggs, pancakes, oatmeal, cereal, etc.  The only negative would be the walk to the park, which was a much farther walk than we anticipated.  However, I do believe they have a shuttle service there, so it would be worth it to inquire about it.  When we arrived back to our room we encountered a small problem and since we were thinking about
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was clean and looks exactly like the pictures.  It's nothing fancy but it rocks as far as price and location!  The kids loved the pools and hot tubs.  It felt great to soak my feet every night after walking all day.   The animal sculpture garden was cool.  The staff was helpful and friendly.  The breakfast offered at the hotel had a nice variety to choose from.  If you want something different there are good restaurants right next door.  Their prices were excellent and the food was yummy after a day at Disneyland.  The walk to Disneyland was close and took like 10 minutes.  We walked to the California hotel and through their lobby right to Downtown Disney and the entrances to Disneyland & California Adventure.    We had a wonderful vacation thanks to the Stovall Inn!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: No thrills but clean, friendly staff, great value and great location
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at Stovalls for 10 nights at end of March/April 2011.  We found the staff to be very friendly and who went out of their way to accommodate any enquiries we had.  We had interconnecting rooms and the rooms were lovely - exactly like the images on their website.  Housekeeping left our room looking lovely and fresh each day.  The pool area was huge and got well used by us, as the weather was warm when we were there.  The topiatry garden created a lovely ambience to the pool setting.  As for breakfast - if you're after cereal, toast, tea, coffee, fruit juice, fresh oranges or apples -  then breakfast was perfect and plentiful.  You could also have danishes and different sorts of donuts - but we were not into that sort of food.  Next door to Stovalls is Coco's Restaurant.
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for business and appreciate your comments. We are excited to hear that you were here for 10 nights and you enjoyed our property. That is great that you were able to walk over to the park and enjoy the scenery on your way over. We hope to see you again!!

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised at how close this place was to Disneyland. Much cheaper than the 'Disney' hotels, but only about a 15 minute walk from the park. Breakfast was a bit limited, but there was an excellent place next door that had well priced meals all day long. Desk staff were not overly helpful, but we were charged correctly and they were available 24 hours which was helpful as our shuttle was due at 5.00am and at least there was someone else awake! Would stay there again for sure.

Summary: This is one of those rare hotels that actually lives up to its positive reviews. Don't expect a luxurious exterior or resort-like amenities, but once inside your room, you'll find as much or more comfort as you would find in a big-name hotel - and at half the price. Big deal if the TV set isn't a flat-screen. Yes, the breakfast selections are limited, but a full-service restaurant is right next door, and prices are reasonable.  You're not there to spend all day in front of a box. And yes, you may have to walk a bit for other restaurants and for Disneyland, but what better way to get some exercise? Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for your comments. We very much appreciate your business. I‚Äôm very glad you had a great time here with us. Summary Heading: Finally a smoking-tolerant hotel with remodeled rooms!
Summary: I was thrilled to come across this gem!  I have been forced to stay at the Motel 6 or the Quality Inn to find a smoking room in/around the Disneyland area. We
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for your business and your comments. We appreciate you letting us know what you think of our property and staff. We always want to hear on things that we can improve on. Our vision is to give exceptional customer service. We hope to see you soon!!

Summary: This was more motel than hotel.  The staff received regular complaints from people while we were there. And then we understood why, we were quoted the wrong room rate but they were not interested.  We kept feeling ill when ever using the A/c it took 6 days to be looked at. They incorrectly booked us on a trip which wasted our last day in LA.  Good things are the location walking distance from Disney and every night we could see the fireworks from the balcony outside the room. The breakfast included is also good value, more healthy variety would be even better

It is our hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you.  Again, I apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit.

Summary: Great place to stay for families - my kids loved the pool (i think there's about three pools and two hot tubs), decent continental breakfast, clean rooms and bathrooms, and very comfortable beds. You can see the fireworks from the second and third floors. it's about a 10-15 min walk (15-20 min if you have young kids like us) to the park if you cut through the Grand Californian Hotel or Downtown Disney.
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking for your review. We appreciate your business. I‚Äôm very happy to hear that you had a great time here with us. That‚Äôs great that you were able to enjoy the pools. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: This hotel is an excellent choice for a location within easy walking distance of Downtown Disney and the theme parks.  If you're going to Disney parks with kids, you wouldn't expect to spend much time in your room, but all of the essentials are there.  Two queen beds per room, refrigerator, chairs, and table, etc.  There are two swimming pools--one heated, the other not, a jacuzzi, and a wading pool.  A continental breakfast is offered with very limited hot breakfast choices.  The facility is very clean and upkeep is good.  The staff is quite helpful.

Our main amenities are fridge, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer, iron and ironing board. I know that these amenities are very helpful when you travel with kids. We hope to see you soon!!

Summary: Stayed here on our trip to Disney. A 20 min walk to park entrance. Room was clean and quiet. Parking all over.   Great pick if you just want to crash after a long day at the park. USD 10 tax for tourism is applied when you get in. They offer a shuttle to take you to the park for USD 4 but to me is not that far. Downtown Disney is just 10 min away.

Summary Heading: Great Beds, Great Breakfast and Short Walk to Disney!
Summary: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in February.  I booked it based on the price and other travelers reviews.  I have a bad back and the reviews on the beds were spot on!!  They have super comfortable and supportive mattresses.  The laundry facilities were great for drying out clothes when we got wet on the rides and they were very cheap too!  There are 2 pools and 2 hot tubs.  Only one pool was heated and both hot tubs were warm . . . but we were fine with that - being from Canada!!   It is about 6 blocks total if you walk down to South Harbour Blvd and then to the Main Disney Entrance but it only took us 15 min.   However, once you have your park tickets, you can cut through the Grand Californian Hotel via California Adventure Park and then it's just a 5 min. walk down Disney
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for taking the time on your review. We do get a lot of complements on our beds. Some of our guest‚Äôs say it‚Äôs the best sleep that they have ever had. Yes, we are only 10-15 minute walk to the park entrance through Downtown Disney. I‚Äôm glad that you enjoyed our pools and breakfast. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Great, clean, friendly, and very close to Disneyland
Summary: This was our very first stop in the USA, and was a very nice warm and friendly welcome.  We stayed for 2 nights and only paid $200.  This was is a very clean and well maintained hotel.  The room was a good size room with extremely soft and very confutable beds, free wifi and a safe.  There is a nice pool area (although was far too cold to swim while we were there).  Close to public transport (bus stop right out the front). I think Disneyland would be the main reason you would stay here, as there is not too much else to do in the Anaheim.  To get to the main entrance of Disneyland and California adventure is only a 10 to 15 min walk or a short $5 to $10 cab ride.    There are also plenty of places to eat (most places very cheap and very nice food).   All in all, nice hotel and in
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review. We appreciate your business. I‚Äôm very glad that we were your very first stop here in Anaheim, CA. We do have free wireless and if you need to print you may use the computer in the lobby that has free printing. It‚Äôs good for printing boarding passes. We are surrounded by restaurants and we do have a new addition in the area called the Garden walk. There are places to eat, shop and have fun. Thank you once again for staying with us. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Was pretty much every thing we were told it was.The beds were very comfortable, and was good because you could walk back from Disneyland,have dinner, relax and walk back for the evening.If I could ask for any thing from management, would ask that they consider a hot breakfast like egg omelet and some sort of meat.I was also told when I booked the room for 5 nights that the $8.00/day parking fee was included in my price,but found out when I got there, that it would cost me another $40.00 for 5 nights.All and all, it was a good bang for the buck.
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for your business and review. I‚Äôm very pleased to hear that you had a great stay. There is a lot of eatery surrounding our area and you can enjoy the scenery while you walk. We do value your opinion and I will pass the word to management about adding some sort of meat to our breakfast. Thank you again and we hope to see you soon!!

Summary Heading: Great accommodation, location, staff and service
Summary: Family of four with two teenagers who spent a week in January. Starting with check in right through to check out we were treated exceptionally well by all of the staff. Had read some reviews earlier prior to travelling so wanted to pass on my opinion. Value for money room, breakfast and location. As we were at the end of a month long holiday all got sick towards the end and didn't feel like walking. Took the opportunity to use the ART bus as directed by reception staff great service and we even got tip from front desk that bus went to the Block outlets giving us a chance to some more bargain shopping. This hotel also had one of the best laundry rooms we had seen all over USA and by far the cheapest. The staff even held laundry open til I finished past the closing time. Would
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and your business we really appreciate it. I‚Äôm sorry to hear that you got a little sick towards the end of your trip. I hope you still had a great time. That‚Äôs great that you were able to use the ART Transit to go to Disney. We hope to see you soon!!

Summary Heading: A Great Place to Stay Close to Disneyland
Summary: I was pinching pennies when I decided on this Best Western location instead of the three resorts inside the Disneyland park.  When I first arrived I was a bit worried as the rooms were facing the parking lot.  With all the other tourists and children, I was afraid I would not get a good night's sleep.  I was wrong.    Once you enter the room it is actually quiet.  Just don't open the window.  I usually turn my fan or a/c on.  The room was clean and really comfortable.    I'm not too crazy about their breakfast though.  It's crowded and was really nothing to rave about.  I decided to go to the restaurants nearby for breakfast.    The walk to the park was about 15-20 minutes (slow pace).
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for taking the time on your review. You opinion is very important to us. I‚Äôm very pleased to hear that you had great stay. We hope that we made your stay very enjoyable. We appreciate your business. Hope to see you soon!

Summary: We checked in pretty much right at 3:00 (their check in time) and the room was ready. When we got to the room, it was clean and pretty spacious, but there was no remote for the TV which was annoying. We called the front desk and one was delivered to us that didn't work, so we called again and finally got a remote that worked. Not a major problem. The door to our room was difficult for us to open. We had to literally shove it open and then slam it closed. I don't know if that was just our room's problem or if the whole hotel is like that. The free wifi was pretty horrible; super slow and the connection kept getting dropped. I don't know if it's because we were too far away from the hot spot or what, but the wifi was almost unusable for us.   The hotel is a very easy walking
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you on taking the time on your review. We really appreciate your business. I do apologize for not having a remote in your room that works and for delivering one that didn‚Äôt work properly. Thank you for letting us know on the internet issue. We have brought in a tech to take care of the problem. We hope that you give us another chance on giving you exceptional service. See you soon!!

Summary Heading: Great value, amazing stay, wonderful experience, great for families!!!
Summary: We have stayed here 5 times, me and my teenage daughter. Its a great walking distance to and from Disneyland. In the mornings it was an easy walk, but after a long day at disney, our feet did get tired, but it wasn't a bad 10-15min walk. Beautiful scenery as we walked to the disney parks. We haven't gone through the Grand Californian hotel, but its not that bad of a walk to the theme parks without going through it, only like an extra 1/2mins.  Breakfast has a good variety of hot foods, cold foods, healthy, sugary, ect. Most of the time my daughter was up before I was so she would leave me a note to go get breakfast, to bring it back to the hotel room. FOr some healthy snacks during the day we would grab 1/2 extra apples to take to the parks with us. Lots of room for our big
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for staying here at the Best Western Stovall‚Äôs Inn. I‚Äôm very happy to hear that you had a great time here and at Disneyland. We appreciate your business and value your opinion. We hope to see you soon!!!

Summary Heading: good place to stay when visting Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here because of the location, close walking distance to Disneyland, when it rained one day we took the bus in front of the hotel which dropped us off closer to the entrance.  The room was spacious, quiet and clean.  Equipped with fridge and microwave and also very close to 2 restaurants (right next door).  The continental breakfast was "acceptable" saved us money but nothing to brag about.  We enjoyed the outdoor hot tub. We would stay there again!  We bought tickets at the counter and found the staff approachable.
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for taking your time on your review. I‚Äôm very pleased to hear that you enjoyed our property. That‚Äôs great that you were able to ride the ART transit for those rainy days that we had. We look forward in seeing you soon!!

Summary: The weather would lighten up on 26th and 27th and so we decided on 25th to go to Disneyland and Legoland. Among the top few hotels on TripAdvisor this was luckily available for a reasonable rate - though higher than average even after AAA discount.  We arrived late - around 10pm. We called at 9 to inquire about food/restaurant and were told that though they had a restaurant on-site, it had closed early - understandable, But in my 2 nights there I never figured where the restaurant was.  Check-in was smooth. They charge for parking and finding a spot near your room is a pure game of luck. The accommodation quarters are motel style though the interiors are quite newly done - except for the Air Conditioning unit which is OLD and LOUD.  Refrigerator, microwave, internet and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time on your review. Your opinion and experience is very important to us. The restaurant that shares our lot is Coco‚Äôs. It‚Äôs right next door to us and I believe they are open pretty late. It‚Äôs great that you were able to ride the ART transit and get a ride to the main entrance. At the end of the day the last thing you want to do is walk to your hotel it‚Äôs a great choice to take the shuttle back. It drops you off in front of the hotel. I do apologize for not giving you the best customer service at check out.  Our vision here at the Best Western Stovall‚Äôs Inn is to lead the industry in superior customer service. We hope to see you soon!!

Summary Heading: Best value for money, close to Disneyland
Summary: We had 4 adults stay in the room, with 2 Queen beds. It still had room for everything, we had 8 suit cases in the room by the last few days, and still we could get around. Service was good, we arrived at 9.30 in the morning and were able to use our room straight away, which was good, a quick change and of to shop. The last time we stayed was 3 years ago, and back then there was no internet or computers to use, how things change. We had to bring our computer down to the lobby to get a connection, but this was fine as it was confortable, we also used the computer in the lobby to check in for our return flight and print out our tickets, this was excellent. They advised that they are getting a new internet provider and this will improve connections in the rooms, this we believe as
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time on your review. We value your opinion and we appreciate your business. We are currently making changes on our internet provider. We are working very hard on making sure we have enough coverage for the whole hotel. I‚Äôm glad that we are your #1 choice. Thank you very much and hope to see you soon!!

Summary: Great hotel my family and I have year passes,we come to Disney 2 to 3 times a month we have stayed in a couple of hotels. So far this has been the best we arrived at 8:30 in the morning check in time is at 3:00 p.m. Are rooms where ready at 8:30 a.m. We had breakfast that is given. Many complain about the breakfast, at least they provide something to eat. If  one wants a great breakfast well then you need to stay in the Disney hotels. Just be thankful, other hotels don't give free breakfast.The rooms are clean and the beds and pillows are comfy. The fridge and microwave were a big help. There is a hotel that we stayed in last month and people give it good reviews, well Stovall's was much cleaner up to date with decor and the breakfast was much better. The only negative there was
Manager Response: We really appreciate your opinion and your business. I‚Äôm pleased to hear that we meet your expectations. I‚Äôm glad that we were able to accommodate you with early check in. It‚Äôs great that you enjoyed your breakfast and accommodations in the room. It is a pleasant walk through the Grand Californian Hotel to Downtown Disney. We hope you return to us soon!

Summary: We stayed here while on our latest Disneyland adventure.  It was in a great location! The walk to Disneyland takes you into Down Town Disney through the Grand California Hotel.  It's a most pleasant walk.  We arrived at 8:45 am and they let us go strait to our room, which was nice.  We also partook of the free continental breakfast.  I was pleased to see the hard boiled eggs....a little protein with all the carbohydrates they provide you with.  The rooms were very clean and spacious.  Very comfortable bed.  Oh, you can also purchase a Two Day Hopper pass directly from them in the lobby, which is pretty convenient!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time on letting us know on your stay. I‚Äôm glad that we were able to accommodate an early check in. We do sell the 2, 3, 4, and 5 day hopper passes at a discounted price for our guests. The 2 day hopper pass is the same price as the gate. They can purchase them here so they don‚Äôt have to stand in line at the park. We really appreciate your business. We hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Awesome stay and close to Disneyland
Summary: We just got back from visiting Disneyland and stayed at this hotel and it was wonderful.  The staff were very helpful and accommodating.  The room was very clean and the beds were very comfy.  We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel as most of the days were at Disneyland but the time we did we really enjoyed our stay
Manager Response: Thank you for your review on your resent stay at the BW Stovall's Inn in Anaheim. Maybe next time you will get a chance to enjoy our wonderful pools which have a beautiful view of our topiary gardens. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: The service we experienced was very good.. My wife and i found the staff to be very friendly and approachable at all times of the hour.When asking for directions from staff at the front desk, alot of times they did not know the answers, but at least they did go out of there way to find an answer for me,so i did appreciate that. The room was a good size for the 2 of us, we were left with plenty of room to leave our stuff/shopping laying around the room. My wife and i both agreed that we had the best sleep ever on those very cosy comfortable beds.. Every night we would get back to our room after a long and exhausting day, and the 1st thing we would do is look forward to our relaxing comfortable bed. The nights were sometimes hot, so we would have to turn on the air conditioning
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for taking the time on your review. You opinion is very important to us. I‚Äôm very pleased to hear that you had great stay. We hope that we made your stay very enjoyable. We appreciate your business. Hope to see you soon!

Summary: Room was ready before check in time. We had a room on the top floor. Room was clean, and enough space for 2 Adults and 2 Children and 4 suitcases.  Beds were very comfortable.  The laundry facility closes at 9 pm which was sometimes a hassle because we'd get back late. The walk to the theme parks are fine in the morning but coming home was a different story, after a long day walking you'll definitely feel it. we had to catch a cab on one of the nights coming home because it started raining. The free breakfast was OK. Staff were friendly and polite. We never had a chance to swim in the pool because it was cold and wet when we were there. This place is a great option if you want to save and don't mind the walk to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for taking your time on your review. I glad you had a great time here and at Disneyland. We hope that next time you get to enjoy our pools. See you next time!!

Summary: Our stay at Stovall's was  good.  Check in was easy and my request for an upper floor was fulfilled.  The room was clean, furniture in good shape, microwave/refrigerator/coffeemaker all worked and plenty of towels.  My husband even commented that he liked the decor of the room!  To avoid the crowd at the breakfast room, I got our food and took it back to the room.  I got a box from the lady stocking the breakfast area - there wasn't any trays for take outs.  The housekeeping staff was great.  Our room was clean and fully stocked when we returned around 3 pm.    Our only unexpected event was when my husband turned on the heater at 4 a.m.  The heated dust in the vent/filter set off the smoke alarm.  He opened up the door to air out the room and the alarm stopped beeping.  Check
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear that you had a great time here at the Best Western Stovall's Inn. I do apologize for the inconvenience. We are cleaning the heaters so this doesn't happen.Thank you for your review and your opinion is very important to us. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: We have stayed twice here this year alone.  It is very close walking distance, especially if you cut through the Grand Californian!!! While breakfast isn't the greatest and can get pretty packed at busy times, it is free and they do offer hard boiled eggs for some protein... the beds are comfy, the rooms clean and hot water is plentiful!!!  Staff has always been kind... this is where these Disney travelers stay......
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to here that you have enjoyed your stay everytime. We hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: To far away, breakfast isn't worth it and the carpets were SO dirty.
Summary: I'm a little bit picky when it comes to my Disney hotels, The Howard Johnson has always been my first choice so this time when it was unavailable our travel agent picked this hotel for us. She said that it was close to the parks and that there was an included breakfast.  If you follow the path to get to the park it will EASILY take you 20 minutes, you don't get to go through the main entrance were the busses park you must go through downtown Disney first. I looked up some advice online first because I was very worried about getting to the park from this hotel and I saw that you can cut out a LOT of walking time if you cut through the Grand Californian, (even though it does make you a little sad everytime you see the beautiful lobby :p) There is also a way to cut into California
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for giving us your review regarding your recent stay at our property.I apologize for not exceeding your expectations. We strive to ensure each and every guest experience is satisfying.Please know that we are taking your feedback to heart and focusing on improving.  It is our hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you. Again, I apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit.

Summary Heading: One of the better value-for-money hotels, but the distance to Disneyland can be alittle far sometimes...
Summary: I stayed for 5 nights in October, and this is truly one of the better value-for-money hotels that I have stayed. The double-room was quite spacious and clean, and the beds were extremely comfortable! I had excellent nights' sleep at the hotel on all 5 nights (even better than the one at Double-tree) and was sad to leave. The room has a fridge and a microwave, but you would need to buy/bring your own utensils and plates. Breakfast is also provided, although it ends pretty early at 9:30AM. There is also a Food for Less and KMart approx. 15 mins walk down Katella Ave. The only downside to the hotel is probably the carpark charges - $8/day when some other Best Westerns in the area do not charge for parking. Also the walk to Disneyland - although it is relatively walkable (approx. 15
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear that you had a great time here at the Best Western Stovall's Inn. Thank you for your review and your opinion is very important to us. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 days and enjoyed our room.   The walk to Disneyland is a good walk, but not 3 days straight. Wear good shoes if you plan to walk. The walk is only about a 15 min walk and if you don't have a Park Hopper (if you do, then you can go straight to the California Grand Hotel and get to California disney that way) you have to walk over to Downtown Disney. There are shuttles as well.   The beds are nice and clean. The room is clean. I didn't find any bugs.   We found the hotel quiet. We wish we what kind of  "coffee machine" they had in the rooms. They use a pod type machine by the way,   All in all, it was a good stay at Stovall's Inn and we will be coming back here again!
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for your review. I'm pleased to know that you had a great time here with us. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: We are regular travellers to Disneyland- about every other year.  We usually stay at a different hotel, but bought a package which included Stovall's as the hotel.  We were very pleased with the convenience and easy walk to Disney's Main Street.  The rooms were clean and staff helpful.  There is some noise from the street, but we were able to block out light and get a decent sleep.  It rained, so we did not use the pool facilities.  Breakfast was crowded, cramped and average- but you can just bring the food back to your room if you want.  There are also two average restaurants nearby if you want to eat out.  Overall, a please surprise and a very good value.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review we appreciate it. Sorry to hear that you weren‚Äôt able to enjoy our wonderful pools due to the rain. I know that sometimes the continental breakfast area gets a little bit crowded. We have installed new sitting areas on the outside of the breakfast room for guests to sit and enjoy. We hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Decent, wifi was horrible, very much a motel.
Summary: Wifi was poor, traveling on business this is pretty much a must have.  Staff were awesome, but having to head to another hotel to leech off of their wifi to get work done killed productivity.  It's a motel, be warned that security is a little bit more lax (your door connects to the parking lot) and noise levels are up.  Nice room though, and again, the staff rocked.  If there were not so many options in the area then I would likely recommend this, but instead I would suggest taking a chance on another.
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking for your review. Sorry to hear that the internet wasn‚Äôt working at the time that you stayed here. We have corrected that problem.  Thank you for the compliment on our staff we appreciate it.  We hope to exceeded everyone expectations.  Hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Excellent stay, great location, surprisingly nice rooms...hotel quality in a motel.
Summary: My boyfriend and I spent four nights here while visiting Disneyland. I did a lot of research to find the best deal, location etc. for a hotel. There were a lot of complaints about the hotels in the area being too noisy on the freeway, dirty or too far from the park. Anyway, we were SO HAPPY with this Best Western. The rooms were really really nice, very clean, I had the best sleep on the super comfortable beds. It's a ten minute walk to the park, cut throught the californian hotel...really one of the best locations. The only issues were little kids running and screaming outside our roon super early in the morning...but who can blame them, they're going to Disney! and the free breakfast they provided was good, but the breakfast room was always packed, so you had to grab your food
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know how your stay was. We appreciate your business and we hope to see you soon!

Summary: I travelled to Anaheim with my 11year old daughter and we just loved this hotel.  We spent 9 nights here and it was very comfortable. Staff are fantastic very friendly, The hotel was very clean. Great value for money.
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for your review. I‚Äôm glad that you enjoyed your stay here with us. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: Very close to Disneyland and resturants.  I would stay here again.  Rooms were older but felt clean and beds were comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your business and we hope to see soon.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, great location, but thin walls
Summary: We stayed here 2 nights while we visited Disney. It was a comfortable walk for two 40 year olds and a 7 year old kid. The shuttle was available as well, but we didn't use it. The Hotel is motel-like and the rooms are a bit cramped, but the decor is updated and the beds were very comfortable. There was a fridge, microwave and coffee maker in the room. The room was very clean, and so was the bathroom. There was a complementary breakfast in the morning which was average; many things were on the sugary side, and the pancakes were microwaved, so a bit hard and rubbery. The coffee was really awful-- make it in your room, it's slightly better. We really loved the pools and hot tubs. My only complaint is the very loud A/C and thin walls. The service was nice; they let us check in early
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for taking the time on your review regarding your recent stay at our property. Your feedback is very much appreciated and I can assure you that my staff and I use this information to do everything possible to create an enjoyable experience for each of our guests.  We hope to see you again.

Summary: This is a nice best western. Check in was easy and Brooklyn was very friendly and provided great customer service. the rooms are nice and very clean and the beds are comfortable. Its about a 15 min walk to the park which in not to bad and there is also a CoCos right next door and it is open late. The hotel  has a  breakfast  room that includes cereal, muffins and when we were there pancakes. Overall I would recommend this hotel very reasonable rates.
Manager Response: I would like to say thank you for taking the time on letting us know how your stay was here at the Best Western Stovall‚Äôs Inn. I'm glad that you got to enjoy the Continental Breakfast. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: We recently spent 7 nights here right across Katella from Disney California Adventure park and Paradise Pier Hotel.  I booked this hotel because they had a special of every 3rd night free and a special rate of $99/night for a large room with 2 queen beds, fridge, microwave, etc.  I saw from the reviews on this site that the hotel and rooms had been recently remodeled and the hotel received overall good reviews.  I travel frequently and stay in fairly nice hotels so at first I was reluctant to stay somewhere so inexpensive, thinking that the low price must mean it's hiding something but I was completely wrong.  I called ahead and asked for a room overlooking the pool area and with a view of the park rides/lights.  When we checked in they did their best to get us a nice room right
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for taking the time on your review. I‚Äôm glad that we were able to grant your request. You got to enjoy the view of the fireworks, pool and beautiful garden. Your feedback is very much appreciated and I can assure you that my staff and I use this information to do everything possible to create an enjoyable experience for each of our guests.  We hope to see you again!

Summary: A great "no frills" motel within an easy 10 minute's walk to Disneyland.  The complex, although older, has been well-maintained and the rooms have been updated.  They are clean and comfortable.  We found the front desk staff to be extremely friendly and helpful.  The facilities offered at the complex are good and the continental breakfast was a bonus.  We stayed at the motel for 9 days so thought a little more variety with the breakfast may have been preferable but understand that most people only visit for a day or two so wouldn't notice that, for example, apples and no other fruit was offered every day for the 9 day period.  Breakfast was sufficient to keep us full until lunchtime.  If you're after luxury, then Best Western Stovall's isn't the place to go but if you're after a
Manager Response: Your feedback is very much appreciated and I can assure you that my staff and I use this information to do everything possible to create an enjoyable experience for each of our guests. We hope to see you again. Thank you for staying at the Best Western Stovalls Inn.

Summary: We stayed from the 13th-19th September 2010. To be honest i wasn't expecting a lot as we had the room at a very reasonable rate. Therefore i had the mind set , you get what you pay for. I couldn't be further from the truth. The room was a very high standard. The hotel was super clean on arrival, well maintained and cleaned daily. The location was fantastic. A fifteen minute walk from Disneyland, you can also see the rides from the hotel which is exciting when you arrive. The staff were friendly and parking was reasonable, secure and safe.  The only negative points would be the breakfast room was really small  (The breakfast was simple but really good. Toast, cereals, pastries, fruit)  and you had to pay for a  shuttle to Disney.   I would definitely recommend the hotel and
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know on you stay here at the Best Western Stovalls Inn. We appreciated you comments. We are working on adding more items to our continental breakfast. The whole Stovalls team whole like to thank you one again and we hope to see you soon!!

Summary Heading: Very happy that we stayed there
Summary: Our stay was excellent.  10 of us rented 3 rooms for 4 nights.  Our experience could not have been better for the price we paid.  The front desk staff were always friendly and very helpful. The breakfasts were as good as any free hotel breakfast I've had, that "free breakfast" part was the main reason I chose this hotel over others in the Disneyland area.  We absolutely loved the rooms, very clean, extremely beautiful and very comfortable.  The only (minor) issue was the refrigerator in one of the rooms was difficult to access because it opened the wrong way.  We enjoyed the pools and the hot tubs, and the easy shuttle access to Disneyland.  The internet computers in the business center and the lobby worked perfectly.  They even had printers for printing boarding passes. Our
Manager Response: I would like to start by thanking you on taking the time on your review. Thank you for mentioning to us about the refrigerator, we will take care of it. Our lobby computer is open 24 hours so you can print out boarding passes. That‚Äôs great that you were able to view the fireworks while visiting the pool it‚Äôs the best view. We hope to see you soon!!

Summary Heading: Great Value Right Next To Disneyland
Summary: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 11 nights at the end of our round the world trip and choose it due the location and excellent price (¬£45-¬£50 a night for those on this side on the Atlantic) and we weren‚Äôt disappointed. This hotel couldn‚Äôt be any closer to the Disney parks without actually being in the Disneyland resort, it is a 5-10 minute walk to Downtown Disney and the park entrances.  The breakfast is exactly as we expected, it is described as continental and that is what you get. Most hotels of similar cost weren‚Äôt offering any breakfast so was a nice touch and was enough to sustain the both of us.  The staff at check in were very friendly and helpful even managing to check us in to our room at 11am on arrival. Disney tickets can be purchased at reception and the staff
Manager Response: I‚Äôm very excited to here that you had a wonderful time while staying with us.  I‚Äôm glad that you were able to enjoy all of the facilities that we have here for our guests. Adding to our renovation we are buying flat screen TV‚Äôs.  We are always looking for things to improve on so your feedback is very important. Thank you very much for taking the time on your review. We hope to see you soon!!

Summary Heading: stovalls inn, the beginning of our road trip
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 7 nights at the start of a three week california road trip.  Upon arrival room was ready for us and we were surprised how big it was.  newly refurbished spotless with fridge, microwave, hairdryer etc.  No safe but we got one free of charge from reception. We didnt have to pay for parking as our booking was made last january (before charges were introduced).  The breakfast was fine but very busy  unless you got in early and often no tables after 8am.  Pools ok but not very warm.  Jacuzzi lovely and hot though.  Laundry great for us with being on a road trip and limited space.  We really enjoyed our walks to and from Disney through the California hotel.  Would we stay again, yes if the price was right.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad that you love our new rooms. We hope to see you soon!!

Summary: we had a great trip to disneyland and stovalls made it even better.this hotel was exactly what we expected,we usually stay at higher end hotels but we figured we could save ourselves some money since all we do is eat breakfast there and sleep there.the included breakfast was fine to get you going,but healthier choices would have been nice such yogourt and "whole grain "bread.we really enjoyed being able to walk to disney and back(no problems walking the distance,10 mins to the parks).cocos restaurant,next door was a great place to eat cheaply as well as millis across the intersection(really good ice cream).the staff at stovalls were very friendly and helpfull.if anyone is as concerned about bugs as much as we are,there were no cockroaches,silverfish,spidersor most
Manager Response: First of all I would like to thank you for taking the time on giving us this review. Management and Staff members appreciate your feedback. We want to make sure you do enjoy your stay and exceed your expectations. We hope to see your guys pretty soon!!

Summary: I stayed at the Stovall's in October 2009 for five days.  It was a very nice stay.  The rooms were updated and very clean.  The cleaning staff did a great job.  Everything worked and there was good water pressure for my shower.    All the staff was quite helpful and friendly.  We went down for breakfast at 7am which was a good time as it wasn't very busy and the food was fresh.  We went at 8 one day and didn't do that again, as the staff had a hard time keeping up with the food stocking.  There was a wide variety,   and all was quite flavorful.  I liked that there was hot food instead of the usual cold continental breakfasts from the area I live in.  The location was good to walk to the Disneyland parks.  I found that my son couldn't make even a short walk on the way back so we
Manager Response: We are very pleased that you have always had a great time staying with us. Thank you for your review we really appreciate it. We look forward in seeing you in October!!!

Summary Heading: Can get noisy, longish walk to Disney
Summary: We stayed here 3 nights, mainly as we got the 3rd night free offer. The hotel was nice, the room was modern though very dark, our bathroom was 10x brighter than the room itself, I think we were on the wrong side of the hotel for natural sunlight. Parking is $8 a day, don't see why they need to charge though. Breakfast is free, they have a better range of breakfast foods then other hotels, but get there early, as they don't refill once they had finished using that days quoter of food. I think breakfast finished at 9 or 930 but there was no choice left what-so-ever, if you got there late. We were at the end of the long line of rooms, and we still had a noisy rooms, kids running screaming outside your rooms all day long, waking you up in the mornings, the dumper truck beeping
Manager Response: Your feedback is very much appreciated and I can assure you that my staff and I use this information to do everything possible to create an enjoyable experience for each of our guests.  Please know that we are taking your feedback to heart and focusing on improving. It is our hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you.

Summary: I stayed here with my partner when we visited Disneyland this summer. I'll start on a positive: the location is perfect if you want to be close to the parks and don't fancy splashing out on any of the Disney hotels. Located at the end of Disneyland Drive, it's a five minute walk to Downtown Disney.  Despite that, I couldn't bear to be at the hotel. Maybe I've been too pampered in the past, but I just did not feel comfortable staying in this very dated and dingy hotel. I couldn't have lasted another night. The breakfast was also very disappointing, so don't depend on it. Service was poor and we had to wait almost an hour after check-in until our room was ready. We didn't visit the pool as it's car-park location was a bit off-putting. It's fine if you want basic accommodation (no
Manager Response: Your feedback is very much appreciated and I can assure you that my staff and I use this information to do everything possible to create an enjoyable experience for each of our guests. We have added more variety to our continental breakfast. I do apologize for the delay on your room being ready. Even though check in is at 3pm we very much try to accommodate guests with an early check in if possible. We do have a place where you can store luggage at no cost if needed.  We hope to see you again.

Summary: Really enjoyed our stay from July 30th to August 5th.  Arrived at 1 pm on the 30th - able to check in to our room immediately (offered top floor - yes please!) - always a bonus! Very clean room - spacious enough for the two of us.  Good storage space for clothes.  Nicely remodelled - bathroom especially clean and new looking which was great.  Only fault was a very loud air conditioning unit - but worked to our advantage as it drowned out the noise from the other guests!  Staff was very friendly.  Always chatted with us when we walked through the lobby - asked us how our day was.  Very helpful with tour and shopping information.  Internet in lobby was helpful - was broken one night and the staff called the maintenance man to let me into the business centre so I could check us in
Manager Response: We are pleased that you had a great time at Disneyland and that you did enjoy your stay with us. Thank you for your review we will share this with our staff. We hope to see you soon!!

Summary: I stayed in the hotel with my families for vacation in disneyland.  For the price is not worth it. The room is very small.  The beds are very small.  There is no view.  The breakfast is very cold.  Even the boiled eggs are very cold and hard.  It doesn't taste fresh.  The coffee is the worst. Tasteless.  Cheap coffee.  Then the orange juice machine was broken.for two days. The bathroom has no sink.   The sink is outside.  Do not forget any of your stuff in the room that has some value. You forget them, you loose them.  If you report to the office, they don't even say sorry.  They don't care.  I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: Let me start by thanking you for your review regarding your recent stay at our property.I apologize for not exceeding your expectations.  We strive to ensure each and every guest experience is satisfying.Please know that we are taking your feedback to heart and focusing on improving.  It is our hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you.   Again, I apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit.

Summary: As an active duty military family, we stayed at this hotel because our ITT office had vouchers for $85 per night.  Positives:  The room had been renovated which was nice.  We had a fridge and microwave.  The hotel is walking distance to Disneyland.  Negatives:  For a 5-night stay, this room was way too tiny.  The room had a terrible smell.  I told the front desk about the smell and a housekeeper came to the door with room spray.  It wasn't enough.  I bought Lysol at a nearby drugstore which we sprayed regularly.  Breakfast was chaotic with people quickly grabbing food as the staff put it out.  I would not stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time on letting us know your experience here at the hotel. I do apologize for the inconvenience I wish that it would have been brought to the front desk manager‚Äôs attention we would have taken care of the problem. We would of asked if you would like to switch to another room and also asked if you would like assistance moving. We do appreciate your business and we hope you give us another chance to exceed your expectations.

Summary: This is a very large hotel, very close to Disney.  It is a great location and you can see a part of the theme park from the top floor, including the fireworks.  Best suggestion is to take the  "ART" service if going to Disney.  The rooms were excellent and large enough.  The facilities were nice.  There is a nightly parking charge of $8 per night.  We noticed a lot of people angry about that but we felt it was reasonable.  The only complaint we had was the "Free" breakfast.  We went down our first morning at 8:30am and there was no hot food, except grits.  They kept promising more was coming and after about 25 minutes, 16 pancakes arrived to feed about 40 people.  Because of the lack of hot food, all the other items were disappearing quickly.  We did not try it again on our next
Manager Response: We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We have added more variety to our breakfast. We have also ordered additional stands that will hold more pool towels. Thank you for mentioning these things in you review. Hope to see you soon!!

Summary Heading: Don't trust the "Hotel Management" (if that's what you call it!)
Summary: We stayed for 4 days...The worse part of the stay was right at the end, where it mattered the most. We "confirmed" a Super Shuttle from the hotel to LAX for 10am. We wrote down 10am on the piece of paper. One of the staff members decided to change our pick up time because SHE thought we didn't need to be at the airport THAT early. The shuttle was apparently 1 hour late after our original time.... BUT we wouldn't know because, according to her, the shuttle came and went. She advised us that the shuttle driver would come into the lobby to call our name so we waited and waited, then nearly 2 hours after the 10am time she decided to tell us that the shuttle had been and gone. We would now have to take a taxi to LAX costing US $100. She blamed us for the problem, not the fact that
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know your experience at the hotel. I do apologize for whole mix up on the shuttle. Normally what we do is call the company that you select or have vouchers too and we make a reservation. With Super Shuttle they give us a time that would be best for your pick and the reason they do that because of traffic. When we have a guest that would like to request a pick up time they tell us that they are not responsible if you miss your flight. I will share this information with the front desk and concierge staff. I hope you give us another chance to exceed you expectations.

Summary: Great location if you are going to Disneyland only about a 10-15min walk.  Rooms were clean and the 2 swimming pools were good. You can see the fireworks from the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Missing Camera/Horrible Breakfast  and 8.00 per day parking
Summary: Our camera is missing from our room and no resolution. The breakfast is served from 6:30-9:30 AM and consisted of of food that wasn't edible. The parking was 8.00 a day which is not right when you are already paying for lodging. Be aware of these items.   The rooms are clean, it is fairly quiet and about 15 minute walk to DIsneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: An average hotel with unusable internet, unresponsive staff and an arrogant owner.
Summary: My wife and I have stayed in Disneyland area hotels on numerous occasions for the last two decades and this was flat out the worst experience we've had.  The room was clean, tastefully decorated and seemed reasonable enough when we first checked in, but that's about it.    The good: 1) The style was a nice, tasteful southwestern design.   2) The room was perfectly clean and the furniture solid and usable.  The bad:  1) I could hear all kinds of noise from outside the room.  I don't know if it was just thin walls or bad construction, but it was enough to annoy me.  I could hear the cleaning staff talking to each other, kids running down the hall and creaking noises from the roof (birds?, squirrels?).  It could be that most people staying here are going to Disneyland, so their
Manager Response: none

Summary: We found this hotel to be well-kept, with nice, clean rooms and very good staff. It is very close to Disney - only a 10 minute walk (max) - in an area that seemed to be very safe at night.  For the money you couldn't do any better.  If visiting DLR I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked this hotel online thinking it would be great since it was "REMODELED" in 2009 & it ws only a 15 mint walk to Disney. It actually looks like they did the cheapest remodel ever because when you look closely everything ws done crappy & cheap. Summary: After having a 5 night stay with two different rooms, we asked for a late checkout.  Our flights out were at 8pm and we wanted to check out around 3pm-4pm.  Our shuttle was scheduled to pick us up at 4pm.  We were flatly told that there was no way as their check out time of noon wasn't flexable.  We told them that we would check out of one of the rooms but wanted to keep one for our luggage. After talking to a supervisor, we were told that we could keep the one room for a $40 charge plus tax.  In addition, a local friend stayed a couple of nights and was charged $8 a day for parking.  We'll never stay there again!

The hotel was a 10 minute walk from Disneyland which meant that we were able to conveniently take a short break at the pool in the afternoon.  Two pools and hot tubs were surrounded by a grassy area with at least 20 topiary animals.    Staff were very friendly and accomodating. It is next door to two restaurants. Lovely gardens along this strip, very picturesque and you can also see the rides from the rooms.  The rooms are nice, has a fridge, microwave, wireless internet for your laptop, aircon,table & chairs. Plenty of parking and the staff are really nice and helpful.  Closest supermarket is 200 metres away but the little shop in the foyer sells milk.  CONS You need to get into a taxi to go
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Older Best Western Motel walking distance to the parks
Summary: This older typical Best western was worth the points we used for the stay. We left the car there and walked each day. Trick is to walk towards the Disneyland hotel and this will link you up to downtown disney and the monorail. We spend very little time here but had no issues and got what we expected. A 2 star with clean rooms and friendly staff.

Summary Heading: For the price, it was OK. Will explore other options next time.
Summary: I checked in on Jul 20 and stayed there for 3 nights for Disneyland. Front desk customer service was average, they were busy and wait times were 2-5 minutes for service. They weren't the friendliest people in the world but it was sufficient.  The rooms themselves were a bit old but it was quite roomy. We had two queen sized beds in there, and there was a big bathroom counter with a sink and a big mirror. The restroom itself was a bit small, and the window above the shower was a little cracked. It felt sort of like a camp restroom. But it was OK.  On the first night there, we found ants on the bathroom counter. At first I was like it's no big deal, just some tiny ants. I killed over 30 of them that night. The next night, they came out again, and we found 1 on the bed. That was

Summary: Very poorly maintained hotel. Also not really within walking distance to Disney as advertised. I am sure you can get better hotels for the price.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family of 5 stayed at the Stovall's Inn for 8 nights from April 6-14.  For a family of 5 who is there to see Disneyland, it was good.  Your really there to sleep.....that's it!    The staff was always friendly.  The view of the fireworks at night was perfect.  And of course with 3 kids, the 2 pools and 2 hot tubs were great.  The free breakfast can and does get busy, so be there early.  The only negative is there did seem to be a lack of hot water for showers.  It was a 15-20 minute walk with our kids aged 10, 8, and 6.  We walked everyday with no problem.    Bottom line....it's clean and the staff were friendly.  Understand this folks, it's no 4 star, probably not even a 3 star.  I would stay here again; no problem!

Summary: My family stayed in the Best Western Stovall for my older daughter's Middle School Band trip to Disneyland. Positives:  Walking distance (20 Minutes) to Disney  Room was clean  Helpful and polite front desk staff  Nice towels in bathroom, newer tile in bathroom.  Small fridge and microwave in room  Hairdryer in room  Negatives:  Facility is old and...well...ugly.  Bathroom had newer tile, but appeared to still have the old, original window and sheetrock. Summary Heading: Great Hotel for a Disneyland vacation
Summary: We just arrived home after our 2nd Disneyland vacation.  This was our second stay at Stovalls and would highly recommend it.  It is clean, close to the park and has continental breakfast.  We travelled this time with our 2 year old son and the hotel provided us with a crib.  A small crib, but a crib.  It is not a fancy hotel by any means, but the price and ammenities are great.  Our room and the hotel were clean as they were last time, great staff, and nice pool/ hot tub.  We did wish that the kiddie pool was heated though.  The breakfast every morning saves a lot of time and money.  The hotel staff is very helpful with all kinds of info from shopping, to theme, parks and directions.
