Summary Heading: Excellent choice for those on a moderate budget
Summary: We were very happy with our stay here.  Comfortable room with everything we needed (hair dryer, microwave, small fridge, large t.v. with cable, free wireless internet etc.).  The room was clean, the staff was friendly and the pool area was great.  I really appreciated that the pool was warm enough to swim in even though we were there on "not so warm" February days. There's a really nice hot tub too.  Easy access to Disneyland via shuttle.  We walked the first couple of days. It isn't far, but we found taking the shuttle better as even a few blocks feels long when your feet are tired and you are with children.

Summary Heading: Stovall inn and suites nice place for Disneyland trip.

I ended up going to the place next store for breakfast.  Convenience wise, it is great how it is close to Disneyland.  It has a good supermarket a few blocks down which is good too.

Summary Heading: Recommended for families and budget travellers

Summary: This is the second time I have stayed here (about 10 yrs ago before) and the hotel is showing some signs of its age but still has a great location and is excellent value for money.  Room was a reasonable size and clean and tidy.  I had a problem with the shower but I reported this and somebody fixed it within 5 mins.  There is a free continental breakfast - quite basic but there is a separate room with cereal, toast, pastries etc.  Beats the old dried up donuts in reception when I last stayed here.  Pool area is nice - two small pools with sunbeds and chairs and tables.  The rooms include a fridge and microwave which was good.  Typical motel style with external doors. Summary: We stayed for 3 nights at BW Stovall on August 10-13 and had a very pleasant stay. Check in was quick (and early!) Summary Heading: OK, but  probably try somewhere else next time.

Summary: As far as 2 star hotels go, this has to be the best in class.  If you are looking to save some money on your Disney trip, this is a good place to start. Appeared the construction was wrapping up when we arrived.  Hotel Management would not let the workers start early or work late in consideration of their guests.  We did not even notice it.  Will definitely consider this place again for a future stay, especially when I figure it saved me about $800 or so compared to the 3 star across the street.

Summary Heading: good budget hotel for disneyland vistors
Summary: The hotel is good for budget travellers. We visited during the busy thanksgiving holiday and got a room at less than $90/day inclusive of all taxes and fees. Though it seems right next to disneyland the gates are a good 15-20 min walk ,so i suggest you use the disneyland shuttle (route F). For $8 for 3 days unlimited rides is a good investment. The shuttle stops right outside the hotel which is one of the best things for the hotel.

Summary: I first want to thank TripAdvisor for this opportunity to share my experience with others. This forum is exactly what travelers need when it comes to making wise decisions based upon there individual needs and/or budgets. My wife and I made a trip to Anaheim specifically to take our grandson to Disneyland as a birthday present. The trip was to be short and sweet. No frills necessary for a 10 year old! And keep it within a reasonable budget for airfare, hotel, meals, tickets, and transportation. We would have liked to make more time, but because of my work and his school, we had to keep it to two nights and two days at Disneyland. Stovall's was a great location and a good price. Summary: I stayed at the Best Western Stovall's Inn from October 1st to 8th, 2005, and it was exactly as I expected - budget, motel-style accommodation.  The hotel is about a 20 minute walk to the main gates of Disneyland and California Adventure.  We learned to cut through the Grand California Hotel (turn left at the Front Desk and follow the signs to Downtown Disney), and that saved us up to 10 minutes.  There is an entrance to California Adventure through this Hotel, and we entered there one day, but another time we were stopped because we weren't guests of that hotel.  Not sure what the true policy is.  Once you've entered Disneyland or California Adventure through the main gates, later in the day you can hop on the Monorail in Downtown Disney and it will take you to Tomorrowland.

Summary: The Stovalls is not a bad hotel and it is also not a 4 star hotel.  It was somewhere in the middle.  The rooms are large, which is a plus on a long stay.  Our room was always cleaned by 12:00 each day when we returned for lunch.  We were not woken-up by excessive noise or maids arriving early.
